characters: THE ILLUMINATED SANTA CLAUS IN THE WINDOW
FROM THE POSITION OF THE DOOR
OVER BLACK... A TITLE CARD RISES... CENTER FRAME...
AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
A STRING OF OUTDOOR CHRISTMAS LIGHTS
CAMERA IS JUST OUTSIDE THE SHOWER STALL, A FEW DEGREES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falling snow drifts upon the Mansard rooftop of a large, isolated, and decrepit New England colonial. Paned windows in the gables are cracked and broken. Worn stone steps lead to a rotting open porch. An equally ragged '48 Chevy Aerosedan sits in the driveway. Behind the house lies a void of evergreen and leafless birch. Far down the road, lies a lone neighborhood house. There are only two houses on this street. Here, Christmas lights are strung, but many of the fat bulbs are burned out. The building appears like a haunted house on Christmas Eve. The windows are dark, except for a pale blue light in the living room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reflection of a bassinet and an eerie blue light wraps around a silver and gold glass bulb celebrating "Baby's First Christmas - 1970."

dialogues.speaker: A BASSINET
dialogues.text: BILLY'S FATHER, early 20's, lights a cigarette while hunched at the foot of a second hand bassinet, hooded by worn blankets. A gooseneck office lamp, shining a purplish light, arcs over the crib...

dialogues.speaker: ZIPPO LIGHTER
dialogues.text: Across the lid of a well worn lighter: Khe Sanh '67-'68. On the base: PVT. LENZ. FRANK is above a Marine Corp Chesty Bulldog and an inscription: "Not afraid, just lonely."

dialogues.speaker: THE FATHER
dialogues.text: Lifts his eyes, lined with dark circles, and reaches out to peel back the edge of a blanket, checking inside the bassinet. CAMERA PUSHES PAST the FATHER to the bassinet, MOVING INTO the opening of the blankets to REVEAL the eyes of a newborn. Although not demonic or supernatural, the eyes are unsettling; inhuman. Yellowed with a chronic jaundice, the eyes are much too focused and intense for a newborn.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: slumps in the corner of the couch, back to father and son, as if imagining herself as far from them as possible. An empty bottle of Tanqueray sits on the coffee table. She turns toward her husband and child looking at them, blank.  She stands, drunk, and moves toward the Evergleam pink aluminum Christmas tree. The mother reaches out...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS ORNAMENT
dialogues.text: "Baby's First Christmas - 1970" is plucked off the tree...

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTHER
dialogues.text: Eyes the father...

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTHER'S HAND
dialogues.text: Crushes the ornament; glass cutting her skin...

dialogues.speaker: THE FATHER
dialogues.text: Glares at his wife, then, turns his eyes down to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Shards of the broken bulb are dotted with blood. Flames from the fireplace are reflected in the shattered glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plate of cookies for Santa ENTERS FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's mother sits in the corner of the couch, cigarette in one hand, a Screwdriver in a highball glass in the other. The room is lit only by the lights of the Christmas tree. In the b.g., the bassinet is long gone. Billy's father, appearing haggard, helps his five year old son, BILLY, place the plate beneath the pink aluminum Christmas tree. Billy's back is to CAMERA and partially obscured by the tree branches. He wears long sleeve pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS LOW MOVING TOWARD her as she glares at them with disgust. She appears anxious; jittery. The years have not been good to her, either...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Why you bothering putting with those cookies? Santa ain't comin' to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young boy turns his head toward her, REVEALING the yellowed irises, staring at her with icy lifelessness.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES as she smiles cruelly at her own joke...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Russians shot his sleigh down. Santa... Claus... is dead.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: His lids subtly flinch as he holds his stare on his mother.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Glares at his wife as he lights a cigarette with the Zippo lighter. He leans down to his son. CAMERA PUSHES IN CLOSE to his lips and Billy's jaundiced ear. The father WHISPERS...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Ease and quickly turn away...

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS BEHIND THE BOY as he charges up the darkened stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTHER
dialogues.text: as she brings the cigarette to her lips, she averts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Billy moves directly toward the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight FLARES INTO CAMERA REVEALING the closet acts as the boy's hidden "fort."

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FLASHLIGHT BEAM
dialogues.text: In the corner of the closet is a six inch triangular hole where wood has rotted or been damaged by termites. A space exits between the closet wall and the inner exterior wall. The boy's hand reaches into the hole and removes a gift enwrapped with cheap Christmas paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To Billy. From Santa."

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Subtly smile as, 0.S., paper tears...

dialogues.speaker: GIFT
dialogues.text: An Aurora plastic model of the Apollo-Soyuz Mission. The date is marked in the artwork. "July 17, 1975"

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Well with tears as he looks down at the closet floor.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S HANDS
dialogues.text: chronically jaundiced, move past the model box and holds the gift tag from Santa Claus whom he knows to be his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS LOW to the floor as it moves toward the closet door, slightly ajar. Outside, a winter wind HOWLS As CAMERA REACHES THE CLOSET the argument is broken by a TOPPLING of a NIGHT STAND. Glass shatters. An adult male MOANS; another. Then, abruptly... SILENCE. In the darkness of the closet, Billy's yellow eyes appear, looking out as if listening with his sense of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA REMAINS LOW to the ground CREEPING DOWN THE HALLWAY as Billy, thin and spidery, crawls cautiously toward his parents' bedroom door. Once there, he lowers his head and places his face flush against the worn carpet to look beneath the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Billy's yellowed eyes peers into the room...

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: His mother's bare feet stand on the carpet beside a blood stained clawed hammer and a large green Hefty lawn trash bag. His father's body lies dead on the floor.  10 11 Another pair of male shoes, those of his mother's LOVER, ENTER FRAME. The bag is picked up the bag. As it SNAPS OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE BEDROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: Billy's eyes vanish as he runs off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door is closed. The room, silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total darkness for a beat... then a faint light appears from the hole in the floor of the closet. Frightened, Billy, his back against the far wall, looks to the hole. Then... deep within the house... more clearly audible from the hole in the closet... a RUSTLE... plastic CRACKLES and DRAGS... strained BREATHS. CAMERA PUSHES TO THE HOLE as Billy leans closer, listens. After a beat, CAMERA ARCS until the HOLE FILLS FRAME. Billy's hand reaches out and pulls at the wood, creating a larger hole. As he tears at the wood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the house, a flashlight shines REVEALING Billy's mother and her LOVER, a fat hairy sweaty man digging a hole in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight beam rolls onto the bloodied face of Billy's father, in the plastic bag which has torn from being dragged. His skull has been crushed by a blunt object across the eyes. His Vietnam Zippo lighter has slipped out of his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: blood soaked hair clings to her face as she pulls up dirt. CAMERA PUSHES PAST her toward the base of the far wall... Exhales of human breath jet from the interior of the wall and into the area beneath the house. Climbing down within the wall... Billy's dark figure reaches the surface.  12 13 14 15

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hearing the SOUND, she spins the flashlight beam toward...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Her son's eyes; watching her. Witnessing.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN as she starts toward him...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: flashlight beam whipping over him, moves back into the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother pauses... then races off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LOOKS DOWN THE WALL as the boy begins to scale upwards; awkward and strained, yet motivated by fear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's mother and lover, covered with wet mud and blood, hustle into the living room. Within the walls... MOVEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A board is POUNDED, then CRACKS allowing the dark form of the boy to appear over the lip of the floor and into the attic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combination lock SNAPS, imprisoning Billy inside the attic.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER AND HER LOVER
dialogues.text: primordial, breathing hard; eyes, locked on the attic door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES ALONG the attic floor. Half of the area is uncovered and beamed, filled with aging loose-fill rock wool. The floor constructed of wood lathe and plaster. Boxes and furniture have been stored precariously across the beams. A path of wood planks leads to a ten foot area of solid floor. BILLY'S FORM ENTERS FRAME, older now; malnourished. CAMERA PUSHES IN as he sits in a rocking chair at the attic window. Older, now, twelve, or so... and, although, seemingly lifeless, Billy is, in fact, a ticking bomb. O.S., MUTED but discernible grotesque female GRUNTS and SIGHS are HEARD THROUGH THE ATTIC DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area is dark and shadowy except for the spill of the fireplace light in the living room below. Billy's Mother is straddled over her heavy sweaty drunken lover who lies on the first landing of the stairway. She is grinding, but he is frustratingly unresponsive. Not dead, just passed out. After a moment, she stops; breathing HARD. She shakes her lover but his response is... unresponsive. She looks at him hatefully. 0.S., in the attic... Billy's ROCKING CHAIR CREAKS. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON HIS MOTHER as her eyes turn upward...

dialogues.speaker: ATTIC DOOR
dialogues.text: initially, this appears to be the MOTHER'S POV, as the door is partially visible in the dark shadows. CAMERA, however, INCHES BACK just before Billy's mother, bottomless, back to CAMERA, ENTERS FRAME and holds below the door. She looks up. As she moves toward the ladder leading to the attic...

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: In the darkness... a baby CRIES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newborn pink baby, AGNES, lies swaddled in a white wicker bassinet, sleeping beneath a soft amber night light.  19 20 21 22

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: The couple peer over the crib INTO CAMERA...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: She's my family, now. O.S... above... FOOTSTEPS. Billy's mother pauses. With a hard expression, her eyes turns up toward the ceiling. As the cheap overhead chandelier begins to sway...

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: In the darkness, Tchaikovsky's "Arabian Dance" RISES...

dialogues.speaker: EYES
dialogues.text: FILL THE FRAME, slashed with noir shadows, only of color, from a string of spare Christmas lights lining the attic wall. CAMERA PULLS BACK, LOW to the FLOOR, REVEALING the spiked tipped legs of a cheap tripod. CAMERA RISES, REVEALING a used Tasco telescope atop the unstable tripod; all in, twenty- five bucks. A bow is stuck on the top along with an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's step-father and mother climb down the attic ladder. She closes the door and secures the combination lock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tears open. A Rite-Aid calibre Christmas card displays Santa checking an open scroll with graphics reading, "Be good for goodness sake!" Signed; "Mommy & your step dad."

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: The telescope ENTERS FRAME and looks out over the 22 neighborhood. Only a few houses with large yards decorated for Christmas populate the area.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: A house reflects over Billy's magnified eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family gathers for Christmas appearing like a Norman Rockwell painting. Americana. Warm. Filled with happiness and love. A teenage girl opens a present and reacts, overwhelmed. She moves to her mother and father and gives them a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once IT FILLS FRAME, the lid opens exposing the yellowed iris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies passed out on the couch, two empty bottles of wine on the floor; a bong on the table. Behind him, a console radio plays, the source of "The Nutcracker"...

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: eight years old, tears Christmas wrapping off a box revealing a knock off Cabbage Patch doll.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Barefoot, in an worn nightgown, reacts with animated joy, however, as if she has received a gift she's always wanted. As her daughter doesn't match the enthusiasm, however, the mother's expression turns hard. O.S... UPSTAIRS... MOVEMENT. Agnes looks up, curious...

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: 'S that Santa's reindeer? Her mother takes a drink from her highball glass while gathering wrapping paper and stuffing it in a Hefty bag.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: There's... nothing... up there. She reaches back and grabs the pack of cigarettes, puts one in her mouth, then feels blindly behind her. She looks back, but cannot find a lighter for her cigarette. Drunk, the mother leans into Agnes with a babying tone...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Want a Christmas cookie? You're my cookie and I could eat you up.  24 25 10. As the mother stands and moves off toward the kitchen, CAMERA CREEPS IN on Agnes. O.S., an ORNAMENT TINKLES. Agnes turns toward the tree...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS TREE
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS MOVING TOWARD a branch rhythmically trembling which causes the ornaments to KNOCK together. CAMERA CONTINUES... INTO THE TREE... TO FIND... behind the tree... a pair of yellow eyes, looking at Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counter is littered with Christmas cookies baking material and supplies; baking utensils, flour and sprinkles. She tosses some cookies onto a plate for Agnes, then moves to the stove, ignites a gas burner and lights her cigarette. The phone, a yellowed wall mounted princess phone... RINGS. The mother reacts, curious as to who could be calling. She picks up the phone and before she can answer... a chilling voice emits from the tiny speakers...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She's my family, now. The mother drops the phone. CAMERA LEADS HER OUT of the kitchen as she races toward the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's mother approaches, pausing in the threshold of the kitchen door. CAMERA PUSHES IN AS she takes an anxious step...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Agnes?

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Agnes is gone, as is the plastic Hefty bag. The wrapping paper, removed and left on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: looks to her husband...

dialogues.speaker: THE COUCH
dialogues.text: Billy's step-father awakens from his stoned sleep...  26 27 11.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Anxiously steps into the room and reacts to a sharp pain under her foot. She looks down...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER'S FOOT
dialogues.text: The ripped out eyes of the knock off cabbage patch doll are stuck to the underneath of her foot...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: CAMERA now SWEEPS INTO HER. Then, with the timbre heard in the disturbing phone calls...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bill-lly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS LOW TO THE GROUND, MOVING RAPIDLY ALONG the hallway as Billy's mother and step-father OUTRACE CAMERA and ENTER FRAME. CAMERA CONTINUES as they run to the attic ladder...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: What have you done?! As she climbs, the step-father pauses. Puzzled by...

dialogues.speaker: THE COMBINATION LOCK
dialogues.text: Remains locked from the outside. The mother's fingers, agitated, frightened, and drunk, fumble with the lock...

dialogues.speaker: STEP-FATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What your mother and I must know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGS open!

dialogues.speaker: STEP-FATHER
dialogues.text: Is Where did you put the baby? Billy's mother rises into the attic....

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTIC
dialogues.text: Vacant. Billy is nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER AND STEP FATHER
dialogues.text: Are stunned. Then, 0.S., downstairs, Agnes SCREAMS!  28 29 30 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS WIDE as the parents run toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: PARENTS
dialogues.text: bound down the stairs, CAMERA RISES to Billy's mother...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Billy!? What have you done?!

dialogues.speaker: THE FAR WALL
dialogues.text: Billy's shadow clutches Agnes's struggling, choking silhouette; shifting and distorting with the blink of the Christmas tree lights.

dialogues.speaker: A 10 FRAME CUT
dialogues.text: turn toward his mother, exposing their yellow tint...

dialogues.speaker: A 10 FRAME CUT
dialogues.text: Holds a briloette ornament, blood dripping tip facing out...

dialogues.speaker: A 10 FRAME CUT
dialogues.text: opens. An eyeball, iris bright blue, is placed inside...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S STEP-FATHER
dialogues.text: Charges Billy...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Backlit against the Christmas lights, reaches out for Agnes...

dialogues.speaker: A 10 FRAME CUT
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWEEPS TOWARD HER struggling for life, the black plastic Hefty bag over her head... one hole in the bag over her right eye indicating Billy has removed one eye, so far...  31 13.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS TREE
dialogues.text: The Step-father ENTERS FRAME, reaching for Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S HAND
dialogues.text: THRUSTS the tear shaped ornament outward.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: the back of his skull erupts. Dangling at the end of the impaling ornament, with the consistency of an egg yolk, the step father's eye; pushed through the skull. He falls...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHRISTMAS TREE
dialogues.text: TOPPLES! CRASHES! covering Agnes and Billy's step- father...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: A string of Christmas tree lights quickly wrap around her neck. Her hands whip to her throat, clutching the cord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy drags his struggling mother into the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER
dialogues.text: Billy grabs a rolling pin, coated with flour...

dialogues.speaker: A PLATE OF CHRISTMAS COOKIES
dialogues.text: CAMERA INCHES on a plate of freshly baked cookies while, in the dark background, Billy raises the rolling pin above his head. The cookies shake from the unseen impact. CAMERA CONTINUES as the cookies tremble with each THUD...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: Billy's hand finds an angel shaped cookie cutter...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: The back of her lifeless head lies on the floor. The angel shaped cutter ENTERS FRAME. As it presses to her face...

dialogues.speaker: OVEN
dialogues.text: A silhouette against the glowing red coils inside the oven, Billy ENTERS FRAME with a cookie sheet, dripping blood...  32 33 14. As the oven opens... the hollow radio plays the beautiful flowing harp strings of "The Nutcracker's" "Intrada..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. After a beat, the front door opens. POLICE OFFICERS, BLUDWORTH and COLQUITT enter, weapons drawn, alarmed, yet cautious. Colquitt moves directly toward the fallen Christmas tree, attending to Agnes. Bludworth continues to the kitchen. Bludworth freezes, expression mortified. CAMERA PULLS BACK REVEALING Billy sitting at the table in the dark; drinking a glass of milk and eating... his Christmas cookies, appearing like shapes of charred jerky with frosting and sprinkles. As Billy calmly finishes his snack, CAMERA CRANES DOWN until the corpse of his mother ENTERS THE F.G...

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK... A TITLE CARD RISES... CENTER FRAME...
dialogues.text: “BLACK CHRISTMAS" Then... a stand up bass with harmonica accents begins a bouncing ball tempo, introducing Mitch Miller and his Orchestra's rendition of "I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus." As the male chorus begins singing, the TITLE CARD FADES...

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I saw Mommy kissing Santa Claus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - A PAIR OF EYES —- COMPOSED FAR LEFT OF FRAME A pair of plastic female eyes on an internally illuminated Nativity figure, presumably Mary, appears afraid; trembling in the freezing wind of a Winter storm...

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... Underneath the mistletoe last night...  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Icy rain streaks past a Magus standing in the snow amongst animals gazing upon a haloed baby in a straw crib beneath His mother and an illuminated angel extending above the tableau.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't see me creep down the stairs to have a peep...

dialogues.speaker: A STRING OF OUTDOOR CHRISTMAS LIGHTS
dialogues.text: Line the rain gutter of a sorority house. Green, red, and white bulbs shudder and TINK in the storm.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thought that I was tucked up in my bedroom fast asleep... Counter to the storm's threat, GIRLS can be heard, 0O.S., INSIDE, having a PARTY; warm, inviting, plenty of laughter and CLINKING glasses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nativity and the lights decorate the front yard of the New England colonial that was once home to the Lenz family. ACROSS THE LOWER LEFT OF FRAME, A TITLE CARD INDICATES...

dialogues.speaker: FIFTEEN YEARS LATER
dialogues.text: The exterior of the house, including the gabled windows and Mansard roof, has been significantly restored in the last twenty-five years, reflecting the money and privilege of the present day occupants. Tonight, pools of color glow in the snow and reflect off the ice from decorative Christmas lights. The interior pulses with a warm amber glow from a fireplace while long thick icicles hang like crystalline fangs from the lip of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then, I saw Mommy tickle Santa Claus/Underneath his beard so snowy white... A '66 Pontiac Parisienne tuna boat is parked in the driveway, just before the garage door. Above, gray smoke floats out the chimney, to be whipped by an angry wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greek letters identify the Phi Kappa Sigma sorority.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT WINDOW 33PT
dialogues.text: Inside, a silver and gold Victorian Christmas tree glitters. Discernible behind the tree, a few sorority sisters are drinking, gossiping, and celebrating the Holidays. Now... CAMERA MOVES... not a hand-held wide angle subjective "killer's P.O.V.," but, rather, on TRACKS along the front facade. The MOVEMENT'S texture remains voyeuristic... CAMERA eerily, unexpectedly, begins RISING... toward the second story... REVEALING windows of individual bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a laugh it would have been/ if daddy had only seen/Mommy kissing Santa Claus last night! CAMERA TRACKS parallel to the rooms, REVEALING a window in which hangs a small holly wreath with white micro lights. MEGAN HELMS, 23, can be seen pacing angrily while on her cell phone. Although furious with whomever is on the receiving end, Megan is clearly trying to keep her voice DOWN. She pulls the phone away and flips it off before hanging up. CAMERA MOVES PAST HER WINDOW just as Megan sits at her desk before an open laptop and looks sickened, at the monitor. The next room is dark, yet not vacant. Attractive and urban, LAUREN HANNON, 21, leans out over the sill of her open window smoking a cigarette. CAMERA CONTINUES as she shudders at the mounting storm and exhales, somewhat sad, before dropping the butt into a beer bottle. CAMERA CONTINUES TO the next room in which CLAIR CROSBY, 20, appears excited, yet anxious while pacing with a sheet of high quality gift wrapping paper, cellophane tape, ribbons and scissors. As she sits, Clair disappears from view... CAMERA BEGINS RISING... toward the third story, while also PUSHING IN ON a gabled window framed with Christmas lights on the top level of the house. Behind the weathered mutins stands an illuminated plastic Santa Claus. The window is ajar; softly KNOCKING against the sill...  34 35 36 17. From the dim spill of the decorative lights, it is apparent the large area behind the window is not a living space, but, rather, the attic which was once Billy Lenz's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cardboard cartons and furniture are stacked and dusty. Behind these, appearing to rise from the floor and within the wall, streams of strained breaths are visible in the cold. The breathing stops... beat... then... with a startling SCREECH an old rocking chair is placed at the window and released. The vacant chair gently rocks... INT. ATTIC - SORORITY HOUSE - NIGHT - THE KILLER'S P.O.V. WIDE ANGLE and HAND HELD, arrhythmic human breaths jet from behind CAMERA as it CREEPS TOWARD a closed square door in the floor, partially framed by faint light seeping from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a corridor of dark wood walls and hardwood floors lit with a string of Christmas lights. The sconces are turned off. CAMERA PUSHES past Clair's room and toward a corner of the ceiling at the shadowy end of the hall, REVEALING an attic trap door. The door lifts. CREAKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is PLUCKED from a bottle...

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL GIFT BOX
dialogues.text: wrapped with tasteful paper and great care sits on the floor amongst scraps of paper and ribbon. The wine cork drops INTO FRAME followed by the CORKSCREW. At this IMAGE SIZE, the corkscrew appears like a threatening auger bit. Thick. Sharp.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR CROSBY
dialogues.text: Unaware of the presence outside her door, Clair appears mixed with dreaded apprehension and excited anticipation as she opens a blank Christmas card and gathers her thoughts. The first being, her thoughts could use some wine. She pours the Pinot into a glass. OUTSIDE, the storm is a CONSTANT presence.  18.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BED
dialogues.text: a couple travel bags are packed, but open. CAMERA INCHES TOWARD her cell phone; red power indicator light blinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang two dry cleaned outfits, wrapped in clear plastic, appearing like body bags in the closet shadows...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: behind Clair; plastic shopping bags and a store wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: STORE WRAPPED GIFT
dialogues.text: The tag reads "To: Lauren Fr: Secret Santa."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enwrapped with different paper; special. The tag reads... "To: My big sister, Leigh. Fr: Her baby sister, Clair."

dialogues.speaker: THE WINE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Is set down beside her, alongside a pair of open scissors. Ominous; a potential tool of murder...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: The nub, sharp. Ink; blood red. It is picked up...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: Considers...

dialogues.speaker: BLANK CHRISTMAS CARD
dialogues.text: She writes... "Leigh..."

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: SIGHS, then takes a long sip of wine...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUNTAIN PEN
dialogues.text: Is returned to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: the dry cleaning plastic RUSTLES. She turns, startles...  19.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRY CLEANING PLASTIC BAGS
dialogues.text: Flutter... the forms appearing like corpses in a morgue...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: Composes, smiles at her startle, then looks to...

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Air wisps through the heating vent...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: takes another sip of wine before her expression conveys she has caught hold of some words for which she has been searching to express complex emotions. She quickly sets down the wine glass and reaches back for the pen...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Clair reaches for the pen, but it is no longer there...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: Puzzled, turns a quarter and looks to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: The pen is gone. A shadow approaches...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR
dialogues.text: As she turns to see which of her sorority sisters has entered... a clear plastic bag whips over her head.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIR'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Like a vacuum, the plastic CLASPS to her face; mouth wide with horror and pain as she takes her last GASP...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUNTAIN PEN
dialogues.text: Is THRUST through the bag and into her eye.

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: As colored shadows struggle over the bed... CAMERA PUSHES IN to REVEAL Clair's cell phone is gone... OVERLAPPING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas gifts wrapped in holiday paper are rummaged by a pair of female hands...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't see Billy's present under the tree, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Phi Kappa Sigma house mother, MRS. MacHENRY, late fifties to early sixties, is on her knees wearing a Santa Claus hat beneath the Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't start the secret Santa without Billy's present. Ms. Mac looks to the gathered sorority sisters...

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Several hang out on sofas, in chairs, and on the floor. Each with a glass of wine, beer, or a shooter. The sisters are not as into this tradition as the house mother. The interior decor is tasteful and reflects the upper economic class of its members. Comfortable and inviting, the room is warmed by an amber glow from a fire in the hearth. The house feels safe and Christmassy. CAMERA BEGINS CREEPING... ARCING... while the girls LAUGH, buzzed from the alcohol and holiday respite from college.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who drew Billy's name? HEATHER LEE, 20, a Charleston, South Carolina blonde, not a hair out of place and a touch self righteous, appears uncomfortable with Ms. Mac's search for Billie's present... MELISSA KITT, 20, Asian, sits with her feet propped on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Um... dude... it's a secret Santa. DANA MATHIS, 20, a daddy's girl ice princess, keeps her eyes focused on painting her nails a tasteful Christmas red...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Who cares about him? Can we just get on with this? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got the red eye to JFK so I can get home and party for a few days before having to deal with family on Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Red eye? Dude, you ain't goin' anywhere. Look outside. It's raining hail the size of Yao Ming's testicles.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I know you never watch any news, so, just look outside... Dana sits up on the couch and stretches to look out while KELLI PRESELY, the youngest member of the sorority who is treated like everyone's little sister, pulls aside the curtains for Dana to look outside.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Can't see.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Then, just listen. They listen to the intense rhythmic thumping on the roof. Melissa gestures as if, "well?"

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: It'll stop. The party gods won't allow me to be here on Christmas break by myself. Melissa laughs and shakes her head as she looks to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: I'll be here, Dana. They're making me work next week.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, right. Hmmm... let's see... get home and go to Ivanka Trump's Christmas party... or... hang here with you and your townie boyfriend, Kyle, and watch "Monster Garage Christmas." Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: You have to work? Dude, that sucks. Everyone should be home for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, kind of expensive to go home. Just saw my mom and dad at Thanksgiving. And, you know, I never had any sisters or brothers to share Christmas with, so... (to Dana) I'll be your family, now...  22. A touch tone house phone ENTERS FRAME... It RINGS; AMPLIFIED to create a startle...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Want me to treat you like I do my sister? (beat) Get the phone. Kelli moves to the phone and answers...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Phi Kappa... CAMERA CREEPS IN as she reacts, absently tilting her head as if this will help her understand the caller...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What..? Who? (beat) Oh, hey, Darin... you kept breakin' up... Storm's bad where you are, huh? Sorry, she's gone home for Christmas break. Try her cell... Merry Christmas. As Kelli hangs up, a MUTED, RINGTONE plays "JINGLE BELLS." MELISSA lifts her behind and removes a cell phone from her back pocket...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Hello... Hey!

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: That is so gay. Melissa throws Dana a "like I care what you think" shrug. She believes the ringtone is cheesy cool. So does Kelli who removes her phone...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: I have the same phone, but mine plays "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." She hits a button and the ring tone begins the tinkling introduction of "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" as she heads back toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I'm so sad for you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Doesn't your phone do anything? Dana holds up her Blackberry...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Validates me. Ms. Mac moves away from the tree, flustered.  23.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Who's not here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Like... everybody.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Chelsea?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Went home, this morning. Melissa hangs up her call...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Greer?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: That was her on the phone. She and Erin and Taylor are on that ski trip with with all the A.D.G. guys next door.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Didn't I see Clair, earlier?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Isn't she upstairs writing a card to her sister?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: No, I think that, maybe, Clair's sister might've already picked her up. Remember, this is that... “occasion for Clair and her sister and her mom to bury the hatchet and rediscover each other."

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I'd like to bury the hatchet with my sister... right in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LOOKS OUT THE ATTIC WINDOW. Suddenly! Clair's dead body ROCKS INTO and FILLS FRAME. The clear plastic shopping bag clings to her frozen bloody horrified expression; skull- like as her eye sockets are empty. As the chair slowly rocks... CREAK... CREAK... CREAK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac sighs, considers, before she calls out to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Kelli, can you run upstairs and bring down whoever's up there? As Kelli hustles off toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS MOVING past the blinking Christmas lights in the dark vacant hallway. Lauren exits and steps into the dim hallway as Kelli bounds up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: We're opening presents. Can you see if Clair's in her room? Lauren turns back down the hall toward Clair's room as Kelli KNOCKS on Megan's door. The response is terse.. what? MEGAN (0.S.) ats Kelli appears concerned by Megan's tone...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Megan... it's Kelli. 41 INT. MEGAN'S ROOM - NIGHT 4l Megan tenses with dread, mouthing "fuck!"

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: We're gonna open presents, downstairs. Once again, Megan tenses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli listens by the door...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Start without me.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: But, you're going to come down, right?  43 25.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't know, Kelli! If I do, I do. Just start without me. Kelli looks up, down the hall toward Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Reacts incredulous and impatient with Megan's behavior...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: I realize you're an only child, so let me explain... Christmas is just Darwin. The weak get eaten. Lauren POUNDS on Clair's door. Then, like a Marine Corp D.I.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're opening presents, NOW! If you're not down there, your gifts will be mine. Lauren walks away from Clair's door without awaiting a response. She tosses to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: AT MEGAN'S DOOR
dialogues.text: Kelli sighs with derision at Lauren's method as she passes enroute to the stairway. Kelli TAPS politely on Megan's door.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Megan... you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes... no... just... FUCK

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Kelli is taken aback. Concerned, she considers knocking again, however, turns and moves off toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac continues rummaging through the presents while Heather remains anxious and somewhat guilty...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac, why don't you open the present we got you?

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Billy always gets his present first. Fifteen year Phi Kappa Sigma tradition.  26. In the b.g., Lauren moves down the stairs into the living room, followed by Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: He's gonna be pih-issed, then come back here and eat us. Ms. Mac reacts to the residue smell of cigarettes left in Lauren's wake.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Not as pissed as I'm gonna be if you've been smoking in your room. Lauren shakes her head with feigned innocence as she swipes someone's full glass of red wine and as she takes a sip...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Must've been Billy's ghost.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Don't think he's dead. Is he?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Watches, then sighs, confessional...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, look... I drew "that name."

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: beneath the tree, Ms. Mac looks to Heather. Lauren pauses mid sip of wine. Dana eyes Melissa, flashes a catty grimace, and mouths "oops." Heather, sitting upright, inches up on the edge of the sofa; posture defensive...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I just say... I'm sorry, but, I am very not okay with any of this. I mean, buying a Christmas present for a serial killer?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Serial killers murder repeatedly for sexual thrill. Billy Lenz was a spree killer. Dude just fuckin' lost it!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What-ever. I'm just offended by a... pagan sacrifice... to ward off evil spirits on Christmas. Ms. Mac moves toward the fireplace and picks up a foot and a half long, two pronged barbecue fork. As she sticks a marshmallow on the end and places it over the fire...  27.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Come on, Heather, it's just a bit of fun... Lauren cuts her off...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Christmas is more about warding off evil spirits than Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the staircase, looking through the rails of the dark wood banister. CAMERA is INCHING FORWARD, as if the P.O.V. of an unidentified person... watching.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Let it go, Heather. Just be happy you had to buy a present for a serial killer instead of Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is rattled and not as good at rancorous debate as Lauren, who knows it...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: What Christmas shit in this room reflects anything Christian? Huh? The girls pause, then look about the room as Lauren randomly points at various Christmas decorations...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's all neo-pagan magik. Christmas tree's a magical rite ensuring the return of the crops. Mistletoe is a conception charm...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Then, get it away from me. Kelli smiles. Lauren's momentum picks up...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Fifth century Christians jacked a Roman winter festival. Twelve days in December when the nights were long and the earth was roamed by the demons of chaos.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I saw them, yesterday, at Wal-Mart.  28.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: And fuckin' Santa Claus? This voyeur that watches you all year and determines if you've behaved to his standards of decency before breaking into your house in the middle of the night? And that's different from what Billy did, how? Ms. Mac smiles as she pulls a toasted marshmallow off the fork and into her mouth as she returns to the tree...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: He didn't break in. Billy lived here.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE PHONE
dialogues.text: Large in the f.g., RINGS! LOUD! Startling. Kelli knows she will be called upon and moves toward the phone...

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEIVER
dialogues.text: CAMERA RISES with the receiver as Kelli lifts it to her ear...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Phi Kappa. CAMERA CREEPS TOWARD HER...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? She listens, then smirks, bemused...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Need to work on it, Kyle. Then quickly, Kelli grows alarmed. She pulls away from the phone and turns to the other girls...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think someone's in trouble... She quickly presses the "hold" button, sets the receiver in the cradle and hits the "speaker" button. CAMERA TILTS DOWN to the PHONE which FILLS THE FRAME... The SOUND emitting through the speaker is like the low wailing of a wounded animal, yet with an edge of unsettling perversity. Although not discernibly obscene, it is quite sexually chilling.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The SOUND freezes the girls with collective anxiety. They are absently drawn together; listening...  29.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's in trouble. Dude's whackin' off with egg nog lube. Melissa GIGGLES and begins adding to the joke, until... The PHONE ERUPTS with a nightmarish cacophony of VOICES; women, men, a crying baby. INSANE and DEMONIC; intertwined with one another. GROANS, DISTANT SHRIEKS, CACKLES; it SOUNDS as if a Dore etching of Hell could speak. Meanwhile, Bing Crosby's rendition of "I'll Be Home For Christmas" plays low on the living room C.D. Meant to be comforting, it subliminally adds to the tension... CAMERA SLOWLY CIRCLES the stunned Phi Kappa sisters' FACES listening to the awful SOUNDS emitting from the phone. Then, cutting through the STATIC of eerie VOICES... yet remaining distant... a VOICE... neither male or female, yet an absolutely crone-like cackle...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bill-ly! What have you done?! The girls are rattled. A MALE VOICE begs...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What your mother and I must know, Billy... is what did you do with the baby? A COARSE, GRAVELLY male voice, intense, insanely lascivious, and yet, mischievous, like an pre-pubescent boy, JUMPS THROUGH the speakers...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where is Agnes?

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--She's our family, now. An eerie, pathetic and sad child asks...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Hey, shouldn't you get goin'? Don't you have lots of toys to deliver tonight to good little boys and girls? While Melissa LAUGHS, Dana and Ms. Mac gesture for Lauren to hang up. Lauren gestures, as if, "don't worry." The voice lowers an octave with insane intensity and, most chilling, extremely matter of fact...  30.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill you. Heather quickly disconnects. The room turns deathly SILENT. The girls look to one another, rattled...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Call the police.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Puh-lease. Police ain't gonna do shit about one whack job phone call.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Campus security is down to, like, one guy 'til after Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Campus security? That's probably who just called.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: That couldn't have been one person.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: What was the caller I.D.? Was it on campus?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't even look. My brain was on Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Dial *69.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: That just calls him back. Unless there's something you need him to clarify...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: A figure steps INTO the F.G., remaining at the top of the darkened stairwell... watching the others. Melissa taps some buttons on the phone, Heather returns to the gathered group of girls, remaining angry at Lauren...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You shouldn't provoke someone like that.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: reacts, puzzled, while looking at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call log says Clair's cell.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The information goes unregistered as everyone is focused on the rising confrontation. Lauren glares at Heather...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: What would you know about dealing with anyone other than a NASCAR dad? Heather's eyes flare with anger. She steps aggressively toward Lauren. Kelli places a restraining hand on Heather...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I'm going home. Disgusted, Heather starts toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, run to daddy.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Is that a problem? Heather stops, then turns, pointedly, at Lauren...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Least my family wants me to come home. From Lauren's reaction, Heather has gone straight for the heart and scored a bull's-eye. The other girls know it...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Guys, c'mon... it's, like, Christmas time. Desperate to break the increasing tension, Ms. Mac returns to the idea of Christmas cheer...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Yeah. Heather, what about your present?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Give it to Billy. The figure steps directly in front of Heather, who stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: In sorority terms, EVE GUARALDI, 23, is a "mistake." A quiet girl whom events in her life could have caused her either to blossom into a social butterfly or a sullen creepy misfit. The latter is the case. The lenses of her glasses are thick, suggesting a past injury rather than merely vision dysfunction. Eve's physical features could pass for an adult Agnes.  32. Wearing a coat and duffel bag over her shoulder, Eve appears ready to leave. She extends a present, wrapped in newspaper, to Heather.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Heather. As Eve looks up and smiles... CAMERA INCHES IN... unnerving.

dialogues.speaker: EVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, everyone. (beat) You're all, like... my family, now.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Heather looks to Kelli, acknowledging the similarity of Eve's statement with the last comment made during the phone call. Heather forces a smile and takes the present without looking at Eve.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That's... so sweet, Eve.

dialogues.speaker: GIFT
dialogues.text: The newspaper tears away REVEALING a piece of bric-a- brac; a glass unicorn. The horn is six inches long and sharp.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Don't quite know what to make of Eve's tacky gift...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I know you like the Bible 'n' stuff. The others exchange "She is so weird" glances. Ms. Mac seizes upon the gift exchange goodwill, albeit a creepy one, to get things back to a lighter mood...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: That's the Christmas spirit! Come on, let's keep it rolling.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER AND EVE
dialogues.text: Heather continues up the stairs while Eve starts down, averting her eyes, as if sad and troubled as Heather passes...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Eve continues through the living room while Ms. Mac hands out presents from under the tree...  44 45 33.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Melissa... Here, Dana. Is Megan coming down? Let me find yours, Eve...

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE DOOR
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS EVE toward the front door. She pauses near the tree. CAMERA INCHES IN ON EVE as she turns back one quarter, ambiguous as to if she's interested in her present or checking if anyone is watching her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan sits at her desk, balled up; feet on the chair, arms hugging her knees. Her eyes are red from crying as she stares at her open laptop screen which is AWAY FROM CAMERA; the specifics on the monitor cannot be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls tear off the wrapping and react with proper warm smiles and appreciation...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: I don't see one for Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Just give her a tequila shot, wish her "Happy Holidays," and she's good to go. Lauren smiles, agrees...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Eve, is Lauren's present under the tree? Ms. Mac turns to check Eve, then reacts, puzzled...

dialogues.speaker: BY THE CHRISTMAS TREE
dialogues.text: The area in which Eve paused at the tree, is vacant...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (CONT'D, O.S.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, did she leave, already? She just kind of snuck out.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN
dialogues.text: The girls look around. Not spotting Eve on a perfunctory glance, they shrug.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Did Eve have someplace to be?  46 47 34.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: The Island of Misfit Toys.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Her mother is a legacy.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: And? Her mother's dead. She'd never know if we threw her out. Father's... wherever. No boyfriend. No family. Like, where does she have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS IN MOTION... along the front of the house through the freezing rain driven by howling winds. The movement reflecting the P.O.V. of a hurried, intense, individual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa takes pity on Lauren who sits with a glass of wine and no Christmas present...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Hey, I understand this is a "secret Santa" thing, but, I know Clair drew your name.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: She get me anything good?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: A music box. Lauren winces...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kelli, can you go see if it's in her room? Kelli starts toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Hey, Mel... um... this music box deal? Is there, like, a cigarette inside it, or anything?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Plays "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."  48 49

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Oh, hell no! But Kelli starts up the stairs. Lauren sighs, drunken...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm startin' to see sugar plum fairies, I don't need to hear the little fuckers, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES ALONG the base of the house, then TILTS up along a lattice, covered with bare Winter vines, running the height of the house seemingly to Megan's second level window with the small holly wreath and white micro lights, yet, also, the plastic Santa stands entry just above in the attic window. A gloved hand reaches out and takes hold of the lattice. CAMERA RISES, as the unseen figure begins to climb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS LOW, near the floor and obliquely angled; 49PT voyeuristic. The texture within THE FRAME is grainy and coarse. A bed is in the b.g., the lighting is low. Visible IN FRAME, a poster of "Alex de Large," Malcolm McDowell in "Clockwork Orange," false eyelash accentuating his maniacal eye, is set directly over the bed with clear push pins. Megan ENTERS FRAME and sits on the bed... CAMERA BEGINS PULLING BACK REVEALING CAMERA has actually been watching Megan's laptop monitor. An Quicktime file plays beside a fileshare website entitled: EYEJACK. The name of the file is... "CLEMENT UNIVERSITY BITCH IN

dialogues.speaker: SORORITY ROOM."
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS OFF THE MONITOR just as a MALE FIGURE ENTERS FRAME. Megan's VOICE emits from the speakers but it is unintelligible. But, the male's response is clear...

dialogues.speaker: MALE FIGURE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How's she ever gonna find out, ‘less one of us tells her? CAMERA PANS ACROSS the dark room FINDING Megan at her desk, crying, ashamed and angry.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR 49PT
dialogues.text: The boy turns over onto his back REVEALING KYLE AUTRY, mid twenties. As he begins unbuttoning his jeans...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Shuts her eyes, intense with regret. O.S., a subtle THUMP; location, indiscernible. On reflex, Megan stops the media player. She holds, listens; afraid of being busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the climber's foot steps on the lattice, the woods BREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan reacts to the 0.S. SOUND, stretching toward her window to look out at the source... until FOOTSTEPS APPROACH and she stops, turns looks toward her door...

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Red and green light spills from the hall beneath the closed doorway. The colors turn to shadows as feet pass...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Holds, listens. O.S., a muted KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Clair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli knocks at a door two rooms down from Megan's...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Clair? She listens, then, as she cautiously turns the doorknob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloved hand reaches INTO FRAME and grabs the wood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli's darkened figure stands in the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Clair? It's Kelli. You in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan listens to Kelli's MUTED VOICE. 0.S., another THUMP. O.S... the MUTED tinkle of a music box playing "DANCE OF THE SUGAR PLUM FAIRY" begins. Megan holds, listening to locate its origin. Then, as suddenly as it began... the MUSIC stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clair's door opens. Kelli exits, her figure dark in the hallway. She turns and starts toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli's feet create shadows as they pass...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Waits for Kelli to move off, then returns to the window... The MUSIC starts, again. Puzzled, Megan listens. She moves away from the window and toward the center of the room. The ghostly SOUND seems to emanate from within the wall. The MUSIC begins travelling, up the wall and to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LOOKS DIRECTLY DOWN on Megan following the MUSIC. As she reaches her door and turns the knob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having steadied and composed, the climbing figure begins ascending toward Megan's window...  59 60 61 62 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Megan opens her door, the MUSIC turns silent. She holds in the doorway, listening. Nothing. SILENCE. Then, down the hall... "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" begins, again. CAMERA PUSHES INTO MEGAN as she turns toward...

dialogues.speaker: CEILING
dialogues.text: The MUSIC is behind the attic trap door...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Moves toward the dark end of the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A duffel bag sits on Heather's bed as she packs. Behind her, the local news plays from an internet feed on her laptop...

dialogues.speaker: WEATHERMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ice accumulations are expected to be three to four inches in most areas. Again... in most areas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli returns to the living room. She shrugs as she sits...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Couldn't find it.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Damn! If I don't hear "The Sugar Plum Fairies," I'll just die! OVERLAPPING... the afore-mentioned MUSIC begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan steps INTO FRAME looking up...

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOOR
dialogues.text: Lit only by Christmas lights at the opposite end of the hall.  63 64 65 39.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: not afraid, but quite curious. The crystalline MUSIC continues. Megan reaches out and grasps a rung on the wood ladder. She begins climbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open window TAPS from the wind. Spill light from the illuminated plastic Santa in the window brings a dim red cast to the usually pitch black room. The trap door opens. Megan rises into the attic, her breath exhaust can be seen in the cold. The MUSIC BOX sounds clean; definitely in this room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SPILL LIGHT
dialogues.text: A tiny ballerina twirls within an open box, reflecting glass and rhinestone. DOWNSTAIRS, O.S., a RAUCOUS LAUGH ERUPTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana wiggles a Jeff Stryker silicon dildo. She eyes Lauren...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Hmm. Wonder who drew my name? As Lauren smirks and raises her glass in a toast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" warbles; SLOWING...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN'S EYES
dialogues.text: turn from the figurine and into the red light tinted room...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Alright... who's fucking with me? O.S., CREAK... CREAK... CREAK. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON HER...

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCKING CHAIR
dialogues.text: A dark figure, silhouetted against the illuminated Santa Claus, rocks in the creaking chair...  66 40.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: remaining with only her head and shoulders through the attic trapdoor, she absently leans closer for a better look...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clair..? What are you doing? From the darkness, a Hefty trash bag WHIPS over Megan's head. The FRAME TURNS BLACK, as if having CUT TO BLACK, however, MEGAN'S HORRIFIED BREATHS remain amplified and intensely PRESENT. Then, a sickening THRUST RIPS a hole in the bag... A tear erupts in the upper corner of FRAME, exposing the back of the illuminated plastic Santa. ANOTHER THRUST! RIP! A second tear slashes ACROSS FRAME... THRASHING, CAMERA, through the two puncture holes, CATCHES flashes of the killer's legs... macabre sparkles of tinsel... the posed dead body of Clair placed in the rocking chair... The silhouetted killer reaches out as if holding Megan still. The other arm cocks backward with a clawed hammer and slings toward the bag...

dialogues.speaker: THE ILLUMINATED SANTA CLAUS IN THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Is spackled with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pauses, as if reacting to the subtle THUMP of the closing attic door, however, she is actually considering the news...

dialogues.speaker: WEATHERMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wireless services report several microwave relay stations are off- line. Now, a relay station sends calls out of the area, so, that is why, your cell may work on local calls, but not long distance... As she sighs, LAUGHTER ERUPTS from the living room...  67 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac sheepishly displays Victoria's Secret lingerie against her body. The drunken girls APPLAUD and LAUGH while Ms. Mac playfully looks inside the gift box...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Does it come with a man to wear it for? More LAUGHS, until Kelli, concerned Ms. Mac may think the joke present is actually the Christmas gift, moves to the tree and searches for another wrapped box.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Here's our real present. She grabs a professionally decorated present and as she hands it to Ms. Mac... the house phone RINGS. Everyone tenses. Melissa moves cautiously toward the phone and checks the caller I.D... MELISSA'S POV - CALLER I.D. Megan Helms.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN
dialogues.text: Melissa smiles nervously and breathes a sigh of relief...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: It's just Megan. As she hits the speaker phone button...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you? Her question is cut off by a horrific SCREAM above a tormented cackle....

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Billl-ly!! Everyone freezes. Shocked. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT HAVE YOU DONE
dialogues.text: Within the call, a heartbroken wail. Suddenly an older male, voice coarse from cigarettes and whiskey, intensely WHISPERS.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What I must know is... where did you put the baby?  68 69 70 42. Kelli looks to the others and mouths a sincere "Fu-hck!" From the phone, a harsher, commanding tone...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where did you put Agnes, Billy? Then, present during the first call, but much more pronounced... an eerie man-child voice...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're my family, now. Upon reflex, Melissa cuts off the call. The CRACKLE of the FIRE is the only SOUND. Kelli breaks the SILENCE as she starts toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What is up Megan's butt, anyway? Melissa and taps a speed dial button.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: That was not Megan. She sighs upon receiving a recording...

dialogues.speaker: CAMPUS SECURITY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have reached the main menu of Clement University campus security. During the Christmas break, our office will be closed from six p.m. December 21st until nine a.m. December 26...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exits her room, closes the door, and starts down the dark hallway. CAMERA HOLDS on the attic door as she PASSES FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli hustles up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Megan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather continues toward the stairway as Kelli passes...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Megan in her room?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I don't know. I was packing.  71 72 43. Kelli opens Megan's door and is startled by a dark figure. Kelli and Heather SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAMS can be HEARD downstairs. The girls and Ms. Mac immediately race toward the stairs. Lauren stands, but drunkenly swoons, before moving toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping nervously out of the shadows and into the dim hallway light, wearing the climber's gloves, is the boy in the video with Megan KYLE AUTRY, mid twenties. Although lacking the polish of a frat brother, Kyle is no dope. He's bad boy handsome; blue collar smarts. In the b.g., Megan's window is closed. Kelli reacts, puzzled, while Heather catches her breath...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Kyle? What are you doing in there? He appears rattled, eyes Heather, then leans in and to whispers rapidly to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I wanted to spend the night with you and I knew that mama son and your "sisters" would kick me out, so I was tryin' to sneak into your room, but, the window wasn't open. I saw Megan's was and it was dark, so I figured she was gone and I climbed up to get to your room. Kelli smiles, touched and believing. Her sorority sisters appear at the top of the stairs and take in the situation...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Is Megan in there?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don't know. As Kelli moves toward the doorknob, Kyle subtly blocks her.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: You climbed up into in her room and you don't know if she's in it?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It's dark.  73 74

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: You think we're fuckin' stupid? You were in Megan's room. The call just came from from Megan's cell. Unaware of the recent phone calls, Kyle assumes this is an accusation of infidelity and tenses, acts innocent...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What call? The girls remain suspicious. With Kyle distracted, Kelli reaches out, turns the knob, and moves past Kyle. He tenses, but realizes restraining her would look bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's laptop sits on her desk in the f.g., turned toward CAMERA and AWAY from the door. A paused image of Megan and Kyle having sex is frozen on the website. Kelli turns on a light. Megan is nowhere to be seen. Kelli moves toward the open closet and peeks inside. Filled with clothes, but no Megan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle keeps a cautious eye on Kelli inside the room while Lauren keeps a suspicious eye on Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Can I just say, I'm sorry, but that call was not Megan or Kyle. That was the fucking devil. And they weren't talking to us. They were talking to Billy. A beat of tension, no one denies this...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Billy? Billy Lenz, the guy that lived in this house? Melissa nods.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, then, you're definitely gettin' punked, ‘cause he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Creep-y. Creep-y. Creep-y!  75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli starts toward Megan's desk. Just as she reaches the desk, the screensaver kicks in. The monitor turns black while a winged eyeball flies around the screen. Kelli searches the desk for Megan's cell, but it is not in sight. She closes the open window, while looking outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAIL and SLEET rain violently upon the house, shrouding the Christmas lights and icicles, which have doubled in size. Accumulated ice causes a branch to SPLIT from the trunk of an oak tree. It hangs precariously over the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she twists the window lock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren's eyes burn a hole in Kyle. Her tone, accusatory...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Where have you been that you didn't?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, you're right. Billy Lenz is my life. Kyle eyes her with resentment and dislike...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You spoiled bitches come here for a couple of years, then leave, I grew up here. I stay here. I played on this street before they turned 'em into Frat houses. This was the house that scared the shit out of us... (pointed to Lauren) My whole life.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: What happened to him? How'd he die? As CAMERA INCHES INTO KYLE... as he tells the following as if around a campfire on Christmas Eve...  77 78 79 46.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You mean, after he washed down his Christmas cookies with a glass of milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES ALONG a decrepit institution....

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Billy was declared insane. Sent him away to the Clark sanitarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MATCHES THE SPEED OF THE PREVIOUS MOVE... then TURNS into a doorway to find a figure sitting in a rocking chair in the dark, presumably Billy...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: Paramedics saved his sister, Agnes, but she lost her right eye. All scarred up, her parents dead, brother a fucking psycho, she was sent to an orphanage. Like, what hope did she ever have that a foster family would take her? CAMERA PANS... REVEALING, however, AGNES in a rocking chair. Sixteen years old, but appearing forty. Behind thick black rimmed glasses, her prosthetic eye is cheap and colorless and, therefore, eerie as it stares straight ahead while the natural bright blue eye looks at an object in her lap...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kicked her out when she turned eighteen... No one's seen her since... CAMERA TILTS to Agnes' lap, finding her lovingly stroking the hair of the eye-less knock off Cabbage Patch doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES ALONG a Hellish prison-like institution; high walls encased by rusty razor wire, while snow falls outside. CAMERA CONTINUES until finding a room, set apart from the others, outlined by a string of colored Christmas lights.  80 81 82 47. Inside, a figure, Billy's silhouette, stands in the window.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: Last Christmas Eve, Billy used cleaning fluid and a string of Christmas lights, decorating his cell... to set himself on fire. Suddenly, the lights turn off. Inside, the room erupts with violent orange flame. The figure vanishes within the fire...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire was so hot, the attendants couldn't open the cell. All that was found of Billy, were ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS ACROSS several unmarked gravestones until STOPPING on one.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D, 0.S.)
dialogues.text: And, now, that's his home. Where he'll be spending the rest of his Christmases. Alone, in an unmarked grave in the asylum cemetery. Snow falls gently on Billy's lonely tombstone. After a beat... a form ENTERS and holds over the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAIL and SLEET rain violently upon the nativity figures now encased with ice which causes their images to appear out of focus. The gusting WIND blows a figure over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are unnerved by the story. Kyle eyes them, aware of the effect. Outside, the STORM is strong.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: They ever find out from him why... he killed his family? Kyle eyes them...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It seemed to him... that's how his family showed their love.  83 84 85 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKS and collapses... sounding exactly like a GUNSHOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRACKING SOUND OVERLAPS. The girls flinch, increasingly anxious; growing afraid...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Just a tree branch. Dana removes a cell phone from her pocket and speed dials...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Well, I have something in common with Billy... I won't be home for Christmas, either. The line BEEP BEEP BEEPS, like a busy signal...

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. Daddy is going to be so worried. As she dials, again, downstairs, the front door CLOSES. The girls look at one another as if, "who's that?" Ms. Mac moves to the top of the stairs, followed by Dana

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway wall acts as a WIPE as CAMERA APPROACHES the top of the stairs... REVEALING... in the living room... a mysterious figure; BACK to CAMERA, wearing a long dark coat, gloves, and covered head, looking toward the Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls tense at the sight of a stranger in the house. With a cautious tone, Ms. Mac calls down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN ON the back of the figure's head as it turns toward CAMERA and removes the hood REVEALING a beautiful brunette woman in her early thirties; noir-dark and with an edge of mystery. She is LEIGH CROSBY and doesn't appear very enthused about being here. Her voice is sensual and husky...  86 87 49.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: She was supposed to call.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: The girls eye one another, uncertain. Suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN
dialogues.text: CAMERA STOPS as LEIGH is in CLOSE-UP...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Claire's sister. (beat) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS AND MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Their alarm heightens, as Clair is now officially "missing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle steps halfway into the room, appearing impatient with Kelli as she continues searching Megan's room...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What're you doin'? I almost killed myself trying to be with you. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: I'm kinda worried about Megan.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Who knows what her deal is? Can we just go to my apartment?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Well, she was kinda weird, before; she was, like, a bitch to me, and that's never happened. Then, we've been getting these weird calls, one from her phone and, now, her window's open, her car is still here, but she's just gone in the middle of this weather? Kelli continues searching. Kyle tenses as he steps further into Megan's room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh eyes the room with an expression of one returning to a location purposefully blocked from memory. Melissa, Heather, and Dana remain guarded.  88 50.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd be back here.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: You're a legacy? What year?

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: I don't know. '93? '94? I started college, late. Quit it, early. Ms. MacHenry reacts, suspicious...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Really? 93's the year I started as house mother, here. I don't remember...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: I mean, this was suppose to be such a big fucking weekend for her and I blew off a trip to Vale with this Cardiologist and I drive all the way over here in this shitty weather? Now, where the fuck is she? The sisters look at one another, unable to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli is at Megan's closet while Kyle, cloaking his anxiety, can't help but pace.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What, exactly, are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Like, some note or something that says she's okay. All her stuff is still there. Her car is out there. CAMERA FOLLOWS KELLI as she moves toward the desk and sits in front of the laptop. The winged eyeball continues flying across the dark screen...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Call her cell. CAMERA CONTINUES over Kelli's shoulder as she considers, then removes her own cell phone from her back pocket. CAMERA CONTINUES teasingly TOWARD the laptop... yet... once at the computer, CAMERA unexpectedly CONTINUES MOVING... veering toward the wall which RAKES ACROSS FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Voice mail...  89 51. CAMERA CONTINUES, then SKEWS, TILTING to the ceiling. CAMERA CROSSES THE CEILING, passing beneath the poster of Malcolm McDowell in "Clockwork Orange" directly over Megan's bed. CAMERA PUSHES TO a clear push-pin tack in the poster's upper left corner. As the pin FILLS FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Meg, it's Kell. Just wondering what happened to you and if you're okay and stuff. Call me. I'm on my cell. Bye. Then, from a motionless state... subtly... slightly... the tack begins to move; wiggles, as if being worked from the other side of the ceiling. Then... quietly... it falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put upon, Leigh holds out a wallet toward Ms. Mac who checks the driver's license...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Clair's last name is Crosby. This says Colvin.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Divorce'll be final in March. No one responds. Leigh sighs...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What else you need? Can't tell you any secrets about my sister 'cause I don't really know her. Don't know much else about this place 'cause I fucking hated it. Leigh gestures beneath the tree.
