dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see Billy still gets his Christmas present. Everyone looks at Heather who recoils, then shakes her head. Ms. Mac appears puzzled as Leigh reaches down and picks up a box wrapped in plain newspaper...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: That wasn't there, before.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: This is new. It's not for Billy. It's for Phi Kappa... from Billy.  90 91 52. Leigh tears the paper to find an Apollo-Soyuz model box. As she opens it, CAMERA PUSHES IN TO REVEAL its contents... a knock off Cabbage Patch doll; eyes ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taunting eyeball screen saver flaps across the monitor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although she and Kyle are alone, Kelli lowers her voice...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What if there's something on her computer, an e-mail, or something, that says where she is? Kyle takes an anxious, unconscious step toward her...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know, I don't feel comfortable... um... whatever... invading... someone's privacy, like that. Try the police again. As she lifts her cell phone... 0.S... a subtle THUMP; outside the house... or... possibly... within the wall. Kelli freezes and looks to Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What was that? O.S., the WIND and HAIL intensify, overwhelming the ability to discern or locate any subtle sounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye-less, macabre, and threatening, lies encased in newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How'd it get under the tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls keep their distance from the doll. Each, too anxious to sit. Except Lauren, whose eyes are red and unfocused from drinking. She points to Leigh...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: She must of put it there. She "found" it.  53.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: You're giving me shit when none of you can tell me where my sister is? (beat) Where's her room? The girls eye one another until Melissa sighs and gestures for Leigh to follow...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Upstairs... As Leigh follows Melissa toward the stairs, Heather picks up the newspaper that enwrapped Eve's gift to her...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Lookit, same paper as the present she gave me. Ms. Mac looks at both papers and immediately tenses as she looks at the aged paper which wrapped the gift from Billy.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: This newspaper is dated December 25... 1983. She passes the paper off to Melissa who examines it...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Eve lives in Billy's room.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: They kept him in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Before that. Remember? She wanted to move in there. Maybe she's obsessed with him. Melissa sighs, skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Eve was by the tree before she left. She could've put it there.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't there, even a half hour ago. I'm positive. Heather starts toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I'm going to see if there's any of that old newspaper, or anything, in her room. Heather starts up the stairs...  92 93 54.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: The whole thing only freaks us out if we know the Billy story. And none of us really cared. Eve couldn't've known Kyle was going to tell us all about Billy.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: But... Kyle did. Heather holds on the stairway as everyone considers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli listens in the center of the room... while Kyle's anxiety over being caught intensifies. O.S., another THUMP. They both pause. She eyes him...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know what it is? The attic window is open.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What? Think she's up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light from the hallway stretches across the room upon the wrapping paper and half empty glass of wine as the door opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh's eyes take in the decor and Clair's personal effects as if looking at the room of a stranger...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: There a boyfriend, something, she could have gone to? Melissa shrugs, then shakes her head, "no."

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Clair sticks to herself. It's like her to leave and not tell anyone. But, she'll be back. Leigh picks up the gift, looking at it anxiously; sadly...

dialogues.speaker: GIFT
dialogues.text: "To: My big sister, Leigh. Fr: Her baby sister, Clair."  94 55.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Leigh's eyes remain on the gift...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: You know her better than I do. (beat) I'm her half-sister. Twelve years older. Clair was in second grade when I moved in here. This room. (beat) Weird how, at this age, twelve years seems like nothing. 'N fact, she seems older. She was the one who wanted to bridge that time... finally get to know each other. (softly) While we could... Leigh is unsettled by her choice of words...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: While we can. (beat ) She must have had second thoughts and bailed. Leigh begins unwrapping the paper until Melissa stops her...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: No... wait 'til she gets back. Leigh forces a cautious smile and places the gift in her pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana, Heather, Lauren and Ms. Mac weigh their suspicions about Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Kyle was in Megan's room. That last call came from Megan's cell. What more do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Kyle... did... tell that story like we were at a campfire.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: And he grew up in town.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with it?  95

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: He's not one of us. Heather starts up the stairs, again...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Either is Eve. Suddenly, Lauren VOMITS on the coffee table. As the girls leap back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While, the living room breaks into COMMOTION, Kelli, near the desk, has the window open and is trying to look out and up toward the attic. The weather impedes her view...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Can't tell.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, it's the window. Let's go to the attic and I'll close it. Heather passes Megan's open doorway enroute to Eve's room. Then... suddenly... the power decreases fifty percent; like a brown out. Kyle instinctively looks to the lights...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Pulls away from the window and turns toward the room. The corner of her eye catches...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER MONITOR 95PT
dialogues.text: The surge causes the computer to switch to battery power, the screen saver vanishes REVEALING a frozen website image of Kyle on Megan's bed having sex.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: As CAMERA SWEEPS IN on her reaction of shock and anger... all the electrical power in the house goes out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Ms. Mac help Lauren up the dark stairs. Orange fireplace light creates long, wavering, macabre shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather holds in the hallway just outside Eve's room. She reaches into her pocket, removes her cell, and opens it.  98 99 57. The light from the display acts as a make-shift flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: What was once Billy's bedroom door is lit with the cold bluish circle of light from Heather's cell. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle appears guilty and, somewhat, relieved...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm really sorry, Kelli. You're really different than these other girls...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: I don't... what? Did Megan do this to you? Kelli's innocent confusion only makes Kyle feel worse...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No. No, she just found out about this being on the fileshare site, tonight. Kelli considers, her realization is crushing...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, that was before you came here. I didn't put it on the net. A guy at work got pissed off at me and stole my tapes...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: My... tapes?! How many are there? YOU FUCKING LIAR! I can't believe this person is you. I can't... compute... how you, Kyle, could do such a thing. I never... ever... saw this was in you. I saw you so differently... He averts his eyes, guiltily...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No one is what other people think they are..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather moves around Eve's dark room by the light of her cell phone display. She opens some drawers in the bureau and subtly rifles through some underwear and t-shirts.  100 101 58.

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: She moves toward Eve's desk, searches the surface, then opens a drawer. As she rifles through the spiral notebooks and loose papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa and Leigh exit Clair's room, reacting to Kelli's screams while Ms. Mac and Dana hustle Lauren toward the bathroom until blocked by Kelli and Kyle storming into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: AM I GOING TO SHOW UP ON THERE? Isn't sex enough? You need a little visual trophy to get your thrills? Facing total humiliation before the outnumbering girls, Kyle turns indignant and defensive. He steps toward her, aggressively and violently; temples and eyes flaring, frightening the others...

dialogues.speaker: FUCKED UP. I GET IT
dialogues.text: Kelli begins crying. Ms. Mac moves to her while Melissa holds onto Lauren, who RETCHES, but holds in from puking...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I got her, Ms. Mac... As Melissa moves Lauren past Leigh, Dana Kelli and Kyle as Ms. Mac holds Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a startle, the CLOSET DOOR slides open. The contents inside are disheveled...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Shines her cell phone light on the mess and reacts with a disgusted wince at the mess. She crouches and begins rifling through the contents...  59.

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE CLOSET
dialogues.text: As she pushes aside some worn shoes and boxes, an irregular hole is REVEALED in the closet wall. It is as if the hole had once been repaired, yet, someone has found its vulnerable area and once again pulled out the wood. It is, perhaps, half a foot wide and so deep as to see the rotted wood of the support beams on the outer wall. The corner of a box, hidden within the wall protrudes out of the hole...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Reaches toward the hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the light of her cell phone, Heather's hand reaches into the hole. She pulls on the shoebox. It doesn't remove easily. She pulls again. Again. Finally, the box slides from the hiding place. Just at the moment, the box is removed and Heather's dim blue light pans away from the hole to the box... the light catches a teasing hint of movement within the wall. As if a figure is rising up to watch her...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Opens the box and removes computer print outs and photocopied newspaper reports. She holds her cell to the sheets of paper...

dialogues.speaker: PAPERS
dialogues.text: eerie in the cold cell phone light, a collection of reports regarding Billy's massacre twenty-five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sickened, digs deeper into the box, removing some papers, she slightly SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOX
dialogues.text: The detached eyes of a doll look up at her...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: As CAMERA PUSHES IN to her reaction of shock, her cellphone BEEPS, a warning that her battery is about to die. As the cell light goes out and Heather is cast into darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle takes a step toward the stairs to leave, then pauses and eyes Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Kelli. I like you so much. I don't blame you for hating my guts but... I wasn't dealing or knocking over 7-1ls. I didn't hurt anybody.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I'll email you a Quicktime of her crying herself to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fuck all you bitches.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Leave, Kyle. Kyle starts down the hall toward the stairs. He can't move as fast as he'd like because of the darkness... The house mother holds Kelli, comforting her, as do Kelli's sorority sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. The door opens, adding a bit of light. Melissa guides Lauren to her knees over the toilet basin. Lauren holds in that position as Melissa moves to the counter, feels for some matches, and begins lighting candles.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS BEHIND HER, ON the FLOOR as she vomits. An amber glow fills the room. Lauren's vomiting is intense. Her toes curl against the floor of old black and white octagon tiles. As her toe inadvertently flips one loose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Ms. Mac and Dana comfort Kelli in the b.g. Leigh looks out the window, puzzled. O.S., DOWNSTAIRS Kyle marches across the living room and SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle storms out of the house and into the storm, charging across the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN
dialogues.text: Dana moves to the desk and looks at the laptop. She closes the lid, disgusted with Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: How fucked up was that? Leigh gestures out the window...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: How fucked up is it that the only other house on this street has power... and this one doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Outside, the streetlights are on. The frat house down the road, although for the most part, dark and vacant, indeed displays functioning exterior Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: DANA AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: As they look to one another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in the candle light, Lauren is pale and clammy as she sits back on her haunches and catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Mel... you're a better sister to me than my sister... Aware Lauren's sentiments derive from intoxication, Melissa smiles...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Dick fucking Cheney's a better sister to you than your sister.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: You know what I'm sayin'...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I feel the same way ‘bout you, Lauren, but... you reek, dude. You need a shower. Can you handle it?  62. Lauren nods. Melissa helps Lauren pull off her vomit stained shirt and tosses it aside, then lifts Lauren to her feet. As they unfasten Lauren's jeans, Lauren wobbles, then grimaces. Having stepped on something, Lauren looks to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Lauren lifts her foot. She has stepped on the loose tile.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Squats and picks up the tile; tests several others. She studies the bad condition of the floor, sighs, and stands...

dialogues.speaker: THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: the tile CLACKS as Melissa tosses it on the counter...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Lauren removes her bra, then begins pulling down her jeans...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll go put a trash can next to your bed.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN'S FEET
dialogues.text: She lifts a foot and pulls off her jeans, then the other foot. Lauren kicks off her pants and steps OUT OF FRAME toward the shower... REVEALING... beneath the floor... in the octagonal hole from the displaced tile... a yellow eye.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Encircled by a dark frame, Lauren is partially obscured as she head under the cold stream..

dialogues.speaker: THE EYE
dialogues.text: Recedes into the darkness beneath the floor...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA IS JUST OUTSIDE THE SHOWER STALL, A FEW DEGREES
dialogues.text: ABOVE the floor. After several beats... a tile... closer to CAMERA and the shower... begins rising... slowly... TAP TAP TAP, until the tile pops out of the floor...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Unobstructed and unaware, stands nearly over CAMERA...  106 107 63.

dialogues.speaker: THE EYES
dialogues.text: As they watch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circle of flashlight shines INTO CAMERA as Leigh and Dana move down old stairs into the basement...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Megan and Clair were upstairs together. I wonder if Megan, like, 'fessed up to Clair and broke down and is hiding in one of the rooms, so she doesn't have to face Kelli. Or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: I'll check the rooms after we get the lights on. My first thought was Kyle turned ‘em off but, he was in the house when they went out.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Eve wasn't. Leigh finds the fuse box, opens the metal door and resets a circuit breaker...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Are underlit by the flashlight. The power does not return...

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Main breaker's under the house. Leigh looks to Dana, uncertain. Dana reacts, defensive.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, I'm not the totally hopeless daddy's girl princess these bitches make me out to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is grabbed...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: As she dries off, the bathroom door OPENS and Melissa returns.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: You okay?  108 109 64.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Stops before the hole. The eye retreats into the darkness. CAMERA, however, DIVES TOWARD and ENTERS the hole... At floor level, the heavily MUTED voices of LEIGH and DANA can be HEARD...

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll go out. I know where it is. Then we can, at least, turn the alarm on.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES through the hole and into an area under the floor... until... HOLDING on a dim, nearly indiscernible human outline, alarmingly skeletal; hair, long and filthy with partial dreadlocks.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What for? It'll take two seconds. Why should we both freeze our asses off? Go check the rooms. The height between floor and ceiling is, perhaps, twelve inches. There is no room for the figure to maneuver from its back to its stomach. Like a macabre crab, the human form crawls on its back, clearly adept at this unnerving quick arachnidan movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS IN THE WALL of the house LOOKING DOWN 25-30 feet as the form appears, limbs outstretched like a spider descending the wall between the support studs and rotted insulation toward the area beneath the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumbing pipes, rocks, sheets of screen, and discarded rusted tools create a surreal and nightmarish underground. At the base of the wall... bare feet appear, crawling down from within the wall. With no room to turn over, the figure traverses on its back across the dirt base toward the lattice along the porch area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa guides Lauren, dressed in t-shirt and thong underwear, into her bed. Melissa pulls up the covers...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Dude... there's a trash can, just right here, ‘kay? Lauren MOANS her understanding, then turns and curls into a fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Merry fucking Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignites, but is whipped violently by the wind...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Sharp icicles cling to the porch overhang. The rain and snow continue falling. As she raises the lighter to the tip of her cigarette, beneath her... MOVEMENT. SCUTTLING.

dialogues.speaker: PORCH CEILING
dialogues.text: A drop of water falls...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: It hits her cigarette with a bull's-eye, extinguishing it...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Of course. She sighs then looks down, dropping the extinguished butt into a knot hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The form SHIFTS, evading the cigarette butt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the SHIFT, Dana aims the flashlight into the hole...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE KNOT HOLE 114PT
dialogues.text: A flash... a glint... of an eye... moving out of view.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: considers, turns her flashlight on, then proceeds to the porch steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCHING MOVEMENT WITH Dana's flashlight, a beam cuts ACROSS FRAME as Leigh turns exits a room and turns into the hallway. She continues to the next door and KNOCKS...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Clair? Megan? She opens the door and shines the light. As she CLOSES it and moves on. As her light CROSSES FRAME, again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana moves down the steps. Slipping on the ice and frozen snow, she proceeds toward the side of the porch, kneels to the lattice, and aims her flashlight under the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area is illuminated by the tube of light; nothing but debris; rusted tools, discarded cans, and rotting boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to abandon the search... Dana holds. CAMERA INCHES IN on her... squinting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the side, under the house, rather than the porch... breath exhaust... HUFFS... with a strained rhythm from an unseen person just behind a wall.  120 121 122 123 124 125 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves off toward the rear side of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh moves up the stairs and into the dark hallway. She moves to a door, KNOCKS, and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is met by a form. Leigh startles, but the flashlight REVEALS a large plastic Santa Claus head. Eerie in the low angle flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leigh closes the door and moves on...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Santa Claus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana quickly scoots along the side of the house, pausing before a trap door, leading under the house... She tests the door, which pulls out. She crouches; eases her head inside...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Eve, you crazy bitch, I see your breath. WHACK! A 1" diameter lead pipe strikes across the bridge of Dana's nose. Blood squirts. She crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COVERING any SOUNDS below the house, Heather MARCHES down the stairs into the living room. Kelli is on the couch, crying, seated beside an increasingly anxious Ms. Mac. Leigh pokes at the logs with an improvised tool, milking all the light and heat out of the fire.  126 127 128 68. Kelli takes a drink from any available alcohol on the table as Heather moves to the headless imitation Cabbage Patch doll wrapped in newspaper. She picks it up, then displays Eve's photocopied news stories about Billy.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Found these. (beat) And this. In the wall of the closet. The girls reacts with alarm as Heather opens her palms and displays a pair of doll's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana's limp body extends from the trap door; her head, just inside. Her body drags; stops. Drags; stops. It finally disappears beneath the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAINT, MUTED, O.S., GROAN causes the girls to pause, listen. They eye one another. Melissa sighs...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: There goes Lauren, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face soaked with blood, her eyes flutter; an animal functioning on lizard brain defenses. She pushes her arm forward with all her strength attempting to escape; pulling her body forward with the strength in her arms, as if swimming in a dirt lake.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Holding a rusted 1/2" thick wire support rod, the dark form lays across Dana's legs.

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Desperately pull along the dirt. CAMERA MOVES BACK, REVEALING a rusted, pronged, hand cultivator. Dana inches toward it.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Grips the rod, but, before it can swing it toward Dana, she manages to grab the cultivator. She blindly swings her hand backward...  129 69.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: The tool plunges above the killer's knee. It reacts, muffling a GROAN OF PAIN. It pulls the prongs from its leg...

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: pulls her hand back and continues trying to get away...

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S HANDS
dialogues.text: Dig at the dirt, exposing several teeth of a mummified, decomposed skull previously buried in a shallow grave.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Scuttles ahead of Dana and drives the cultivator into Dana's skull. A prong breaks off from the impact. A sick DULL CRACK and Dana's body turns motionless. Dead. CAMERA INCHES BACK as Dana's murderer, blood stained, exhausted, HUFFS like an animal. CAMERA PUSHES IN as the form moves; left arm extends as the left leg bends, pulls forward, then shifts as the right side repeats the move. Lizard like, the form CLEARS FRAME... As CAMERA TILTS to the ground... a skull FILLS FRAME. An impact fracture splits the skull across the brow. Beside the skull lies a Vietnam Zippo lighter with the name PVT. LENZ. FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE AREA
dialogues.text: The form reaches up through an open section at the base of the floor and into a vertical space between the walls. Squirming; pulling upward and disappearing OUT OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is pulled out of the box; fabric torn. Eyes, empty.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This doll is new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is nearly dead. Outside, the freezing rain HOWLS and intermittently, the roof is pelted with HAIL. Melissa examines the discovered doll's eyes, then points at the doll found tonight under the tree...  130 131 132 70.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These eyes are aged. They're not from the same doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA is in Eve's room as the door opens and Leigh enters. The girls muted VOICES are barely audible...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What if those are from Agnes' doll? Twenty-five years ago? Eve could've found them. She lives in Billy's old room. The energy in the empty room is unsettling and haunting. Leigh is quick to turn and leave. As she closes the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh is at the end of the hallway. She pauses, having run out of rooms. HAIL begins to pummel the roof. Leigh looks up toward the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Lot of girls have lived in that room, before Eve.

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTIC DOOR
dialogues.text: As CAMERA RISES UPWARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the STORM INTENSIFIES... HAIL RIDDLES the ROOF. Heather, Ms. Mac, Melissa, and Kelli are in the dark living room. Their anxiety, intensifying. Delivery, faster, hurried and often whispered.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What if she's the first to get it in her head that she's like him? Doesn't have a family, just like him.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: He had a family.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: It was pretty random when she said... "we're her family." CAMERA BEGINS TO CREEP... ARCING IN THE ROOM until the house phone ENTERS FRAME...  133 134 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh moves under the attic trap door, studying it. As she takes a step onto the first rung...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES TO ARC... The house PHONE FILLS nearly three quarters of THE FRAME. The girls hold, silhouettes against the window...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Eve was here when we got the calls.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: The calls came from Clair and Megan's cells. They're both missing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: She could have stolen Clair and Megan's cell phones...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: But we didn't get a call from Eve.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: She doesn't own a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (accusatory ) And she didn't disappear. She left. In the b.g., a cell RINGTONE goes off... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMEN
dialogues.text: Tense. Kelli eases, then uneasy...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Must be Kyle... She pulls out her cell and checks the caller I.D... KELLI'S CELL PHONE DISPLAY - CALLER I.D. DANA MATHIS CELL.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: A raw nerve, Kelli battles to maintain composure... she nearly screams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh hears Kelli and the others' reaction. Leigh's head turns toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened... Kelli engages the "send" button.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Dana? A witch-like CRY blares from the phone; Billy's mother.

dialogues.speaker: BILL-LY
dialogues.text: Kelli pulls the phone away, breathing hard. Ms. Mac SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh steps off the ladder and hustles toward the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others crowd around, listening. Leigh appears in the background moving down the stairs. What SOUNDS like Billy's step father GROWLS...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (CONT'D, V.O.)
dialogues.text: What did you do with the baby? Kelli closes her eyes as if that could shut out the sound. Leigh quickly approaches the others...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They're my family, now. The caller disconnects. No DIAL TONE. SILENCE, except for the CRACKLE of the dying fire. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON KELLI, realizing, then alarmed...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Dana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crisscrossing flashlight beams backlight a falling sheet of hail and ice as the storm intensifies. Kelli, Melissa, Heather, and Leigh, hustle down the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Dana?! Dude, where you at? Melissa slips and falls on the treacherous icy surface. The others help her to her feet. Leigh looks over the ground. The girls must shout in the storm...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: No footprints. Iced over.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: She went around back to the control box. As Melissa, flashlight in hand, and Kelli start off, gingerly, but with haste... CAMERA INCHES INTO HEATHER, flashlight in her hand, looking with suspicion, 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE STREET
dialogues.text: An '89 Toyota Corolla with a replaced front end side panel painted primer gray, is parked about fifty feet down the street from the front of the sorority house...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Heather reacts, puzzled and incredulous...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Eve's car. She never left. She moves off. Leigh steps INTO FRAME, annoyed with Heather...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Find Dana, first. Leigh checks Melissa and Kelli, who have advanced along the side of the house. Not wanting anyone to be out here alone, Leigh sighs and starts after Heather...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Melissa proceed along the side of the house. In fact, Melissa uses the wall for support...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Dude! Dude!  141 142 143 74. Kelli slips, falling near the trap door in the side of the house. Melissa moves to help, aiming the flashlight on Kelli. Kelli absently places her hand on the frame as a crutch, then looks to Melissa, alarmed. Kelli points to the door. CAMERA SWEEPS toward Kelli's finger pointing to the doorframe marked with Christmas red nail polish scratches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's side front end of Eve's car FILLS THE FRAME as Heather approaches, followed by Leigh. Heather aims her flashlight toward the Corolla's interior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Melissa are on their hands and knees trying to open the trap door. Kelli quickly looks about the area.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Point the light under the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather's flashlight beam FLARES INTO CAMERA as she APPROACHES the rear end of Eve's car. The back of a head and shoulders can be seen resting against the driver's window...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: As they near the driver's side door...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What is she doing? Sleeping in her car! It's, like, zero degrees... Heather reaches out and pulls up on the doorhandle. Leigh reaches GRABS her hand; a startle.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: If she's asleep... (beat) Why aren't the windows fogged? Heather releases the handle, steps back, but, the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: CAR DOOR
dialogues.text: Eve's body, streaked with blood, tumbles TOWARD CAMERA...  144 145 146 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa's panning flashlight beam flares INTO CAMERA. O.S., Heather SCREAMS. Kelli and Melissa tear off toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh hyperventilates beside the car while Heather has moved away, CRYING. Kelli and Melissa approach and see the corpse...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Holy FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: EVE'S BODY
dialogues.text: Lies half in and out of the car, her head on the ground REVEALING both eyes have been removed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN as she realizes...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: He's out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four women race into the living room and SLAM the

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MAC
dialogues.text: Startles; frightened.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, MELISSA, HEATHER
dialogues.text: Heather bolts the door while Kelli marches directly to the house phone and picks it up. It's dead. Kelli removes her cell phone, while pacing, dials

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Damn it. Kelli continues pacing as she hits re-dial; listens...  76.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit! As Kelli tries re-dial, again...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: What is going on?! Melissa, Heather, and Leigh hesitate, unsure of who should tell Ms. Mac, as well as how to tell her...

dialogues.speaker: FUHHHHHCK
dialogues.text: Everyone turns toward Kelli as she hits re-dial, yet again...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 911 is experiencing heavy caller traffic because of the storm.. All are rattled and anxious. Leigh looks out the front window. Heather and Melissa move from window to window, assuring they are secure.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Why?! What?!

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Hello? Yeah... a girl is... dead... outside. Yes, I know her... Eve Guaraldi... Ms. Mac reacts, horrified. She looks to the others...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're positive she's been murdered...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MAC
dialogues.text: As CAMERA PUSHES IN on her...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Billy's home for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls shoot each other anxious glances...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: No. No, Ms. Mac. Billy is dead.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: (into phone) Three other girls... Kelli looks carefully to Leigh, who, anticipating what Kelli must report...  77.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Are missing... missing.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Are missing... and... what? 566 Oakdale. There's only two houses on the... right... Phi Kappa sorority... Kelli Presley... how long 'til... What?! No! No... She hesitates, reluctant to admit...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We think he's still outside... Would you wait around that long after what I just told you? Upon hearing this, Ms. Mac marches across the room and disappears into a small bedroom off the hallway while Heather, Melissa, and Leigh tense, reacting with dread...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, isn't there any way..? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: YOU FUCKER
dialogues.text: Kelli hits the "end" button; more afraid than angry...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The storm. Pile-ups all over 91. Reservists can't make it in 'cause the streets are all ice. Trees falling. Power's out everywhere. They... maybe... maybe... can be here... in two hours. Ms. Mac returns wearing her winter coat, carrying her purse and keys in hand...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Well, we'll all be out of here in two minutes. Get your things... Heather approves of the idea and rushes off for her coat.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I'm not going outside. He's outside.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What about Dana?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We'll only go up to the A.D.G. House. Get help.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: They've all gone home or skiing.  78.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Whose family lives the closest? Call them.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Lauren's. Her mother lives in Boston.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Even if you could reach her on a cell phone, it'd be at least four or five hours 'til she got here.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: And she's in Bermuda with some guy. Melissa reacts, frightened as she suddenly recalls...

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Lauren! Melissa takes off, running for the stairs in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Done. Case closed. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: No! We stay together. We lock up the house, everyone grabs a fireplace poker, or ski pole, or some shit, and for the next two hours, not let each other out of our sights.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: No! We'll drive to the police.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: In this weather?

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Even if they can't do anything. We'll all be safe, there.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: We're not all here. If we were, I'd go.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: That's right... Unless I see otherwise... I am believing Clair is... alive. And when she comes back... it's not going to be to an empty house. As Leigh moves away, ending the discussion...  147 148 149 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS MOVING, LOW TO THE FLOOR as Melissa races up the top of the stairs and down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door BURST open! Melissa tenses in the doorway, as she looks 0.S. CAMERA PULLS BACK, REVEALING a motionless mass beneath comforter and sheets... Melissa steadies herself, then inches toward the bed. With dread and fear, she reaches out and grabs a piece of the comforter. She whips off the covers...

dialogues.speaker: BED
dialogues.text: Lauren sleeps it off. Drool drips from the corner of her mouth. As Lauren releases a teeth rattling SNORE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather returns wearing her coat, moving directly to the door. Kelli blocks her path, placing her hand on the knob.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Please! We're safer sticking together.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Alright. (beat) Then, get your coats. (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: We're sisters. Act like it. Heather knocks Kelli's hand away and opens the door. The WIND SCREAMS, blowing hail into the entrance. She starts off toward the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: We'll get the police here, fast as we can. Ms. Mac hugs Kelli, then moves off after Heather. CAMERA PUSHES INTO KELLI watching them move toward the driveway...  150 151 152 153 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porch and the front end of the garage obstructs the view of Ms. Mac's car. Only the rear passenger side is in view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli closes the door, bolts it, and moves toward the stairs, while addressing Leigh...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Can't see the driveway. Maybe from Lauren's room... As Leigh moves from the window, following Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LEADS Ms. Mac and Heather, hustling to the car. Their footsteps CLICK and CRUNCH on the icy surface until Ms. Mac falls. Heather has difficulty with her own footing while helping Ms. Mac to her feet. They manage to proceed toward the driveway REVEALING a dented and dinged '66 Pontiac Parisienne and not in cherry condition. The wheel wells are rusted. Much of this is difficult to discern as the Pontiac is encrusted with ice and snow.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER DOOR
dialogues.text: Heather pulls on the door handle, ice CRACKS and STRAINS, but the door is sealed shut by ice. She YANKS harder, then looks around, seeing if anyone is approaching, then YANKS again...

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S SIDE
dialogues.text: Likewise, Ms. Mac's door is frozen closed. She kicks at the car with her heel. A sheet of ice CRACKS and falls away from the metal. She rushes inside, climbing into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac inserts the keys into the ignition. In the passenger window, Heather is a silhouette, pulling on the doorhandle, knocking on the window, trying to free the car from ice... The engine won't turn over. Ms. Mac pumps the gas pedal and tries again. The ENGINE STRAINS...  154 155 156 157 81.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: C'mon, you piece-a-shit!

dialogues.speaker: THE IGNITION
dialogues.text: key is cranked...

dialogues.speaker: THE DASHBOARD
dialogues.text: The RADIO COMES TO LIFE... Judy Garland's haunting "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pontiac STARTS. Exhaust BELCHES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac CRANKS the heater and DEFROSTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA INCHES IN OVER Heather's shoulder as she desperately tries opening the door. As she turns back...

dialogues.speaker: EVE'S CAR
dialogues.text: The door remains open. Eve's body; in the position it was discovered... HEATHER — LOW ANGLE Reminded of Eve's fate, Heather pulls harder on the door. At this angle, the attic window looms above. Unbeknownst to Heather, Clair's body sits at the window in the rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: OVER HEATHER'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As Heather turns back around, CRACK! A pane of ice SHATTERS! Heather SCREAMS! The door pops open REVEALING Ms. Mac on her back, having kicked the passenger door open with her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh enter and move directly to the window. Melissa crosses to the window, as well...

dialogues.speaker: OUT WINDOW 157PT
dialogues.text: From this vantage, also, only the rear of the Pontiac can be seen. Exhaust pumps from the tail pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli, Leigh, and Melissa eye one another, relieved...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: They got the car started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is now in the passenger seat. She locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Go! Gol! The front windshield appears opaque from the ice and snow. Ms. Mac tries the wipers, but they strain against the ice. The visibility out the window remains nil. Ms. Mac turns and reaches over the back seat. Incredulous, Heather turns toward the back seat, also...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! While their attention is away from the front of the car... a shadowy form crosses the front end and disappears. Ms. Mac produces an ice scraper, then extends it to Heather as if, "go scrape the ice."

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that thing? Ms. Mac sighs, turns, and exits the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's door remains open as CAMERA ARCS with Ms. Mac around the front end to the windshield. She begins SCRAPING the ice. It is thick and needs plenty of elbow grease.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: (muttering) Precious... frigid... princess... southern... privileged... bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160 83. Suddenly... the vehicle rocks... lurches... just once. Ms. Mac pauses, anxious, then continues scraping. Faster.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT WINDOW
dialogues.text: A piece of ice breaks away creating a three inch diameter window into the front seat. MOTION... a head turns... REVEALING... a yellow eye.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MAC
dialogues.text: Tenses... frozen with fear...

dialogues.speaker: OVER MS. MAC'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: From the interior, the frosted opaque window suddenly splashes... erupts... with Heather's blood.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MAC
dialogues.text: Leaping back, hyperventilating, backs into the closed garage door with some force, causing, O.S., a LOUD CRACK!

dialogues.speaker: LIP OF THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Several thick stalactite icicles BREAK OFF.

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: CAMERA RACES TOWARD HER as if a plummeting icicle...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC
dialogues.text: Upon reflex, backed against the garage, Ms. Mac raises her arms shielding herself. It is futile. As her head is impaled and split by the ice dagger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the car IDLES. Judy Garland SINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli looks to Melissa and Leigh while Lauren remains dead to the world on her bed...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Should we go out and check on them?

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Car's idling. Radio's on.  161
Then... a CELL RINGTONE... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy." CAMERA PUSHES IN on Kelli and Leigh... scared.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Turns to them, afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kelli removes her phone and reads the caller I.D. panel, she stifles a frightened WHIMPER...

dialogues.speaker: CELL PHONE CALLER I.D. DISPLAY
dialogues.text: BARBARA MacHENRY.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Quickly answers. With desperate hope...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac? The eerie man-child voice declares...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They're my family, now. Kelli abruptly disconnects; tries to be strong, battling frightened tears. Leigh looks at Melissa...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Stay with your friend. Leigh takes Kelli by the arm. As they start out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: race into the kitchen and look out a side window.

dialogues.speaker: OUT KITCHEN WINDOW61
dialogues.text: This vantage is also partially obscured by the opposite garage wall. The Pontiac driver's side door is open as the vehicle continues IDLING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh struggle to see the entire picture...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Can't tell if they're out there.  162 163 164 165 85. Kelli starts toward another door. CAMERA FOLLOWS as they move to another door off the kitchen. Kelli aims the flashlight at the doorknob and opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage holds no vehicles but, rather, acts as a storage area; cluttered and maze-like.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: Stepping into the garage, Leigh looses her footing. Kelli catches her, then shines the flashlight onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FLASHLIGHT BEAM
dialogues.text: A puddle of water, created by a leak from above...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Careful. Roof's leaking.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: Continue through the boxes, furniture, and old bicycles toward the closed garage door. As they reach the door, Kelli slips, falling to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: Drops. Rolls; REVEALING not a puddle of water, but one of blood, seeping in through the outside at the base of the garage door...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: Kelli SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli's SCREAM is deep within the house, but is nonetheless HEARD by Melissa looking out the window to the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh try lifting the garage door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mac's dead body lies slumped against the garage door preventing it from opening. Then... a form ENTERS FRAME... just a shoulder... and HOLDS.  166 167 168 169 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa moves to the door and opens it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa steps into the hallway, looking toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: From the darkness behind her, a black plastic bag is whipped over her head. She reaches for her throat, struggles. The plastic vacuums to her face as she GASPS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh desperately push against the garage door...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Feels like... there might be a body blocking it. Then, OUTSIDE, O.S., the Pontiac ENGINE dies. The radio Christmas MUSIC turns SILENT. Someone is out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. O.S., the rhythmic CLICK... CLICK... CLICK... of mechanized winding. Clair's gift to Lauren, the music box, is SET INTO FRAME by a hand with blood stained fingers. The doll turns as "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" begins...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Asleep. Her image is odd, distorted; light bending and refracting colors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS CAMERA is looking at Lauren through Eve's gift to Heather, the glass unicorn's horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ornament is clutched by a hand stained with sweat and blood. After a beat... the ornament moves... toward Lauren.  170 171 172 173 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballerina twirls...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE GLASS ORNAMENT
dialogues.text: Her image distorts as the horn approaches. Once over her... the ornament pauses. Lauren's eyes open... groggy... drunken. Then, as she looks up and see the figure standing over her...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Hmm. Yeah. Merry Fucking Christmas. Lauren's eyes suddenly flash with horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is dead. The room, dark and icy blue. Blood stained and perspiring, even in the cold house, Kelli and Leigh run into the living room from the kitchen. OUTSIDE, a THUMP, THUMP, like heavy footsteps. Kelli looks toward the front window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark figure crosses the porch toward the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they turn and hustle toward the staircase...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Their urgency intensifies. Kelli bounds up the steps two at a time. Leigh, however, hesitates and quickly reaches out into the living room...

dialogues.speaker: MS. MAC'S BBQ/MARSHMALLOW TOASTING FORK
dialogues.text: Leigh's hand grabs it. As it's whisked OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh tear down the hallway as the POUNDING continues DOWN on the front door...  174 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK from the threshold as Kelli and Leigh enter REVEALING... Melissa is gone. Lauren, however, remains in bed. One bare foot is out over the side outside of the covers. She lies on her back with her arm, the crook of her inner elbow, over her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Awww, fuck, no! (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: He'll hear you! Leigh closes the door. She BOLTS the LOCK. Kelli tugs at Lauren's foot, while whispering...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Lauren, where's Mel?! DOWNSTAIRS, a window SHATTERS! Kelli tugs on Lauren's foot...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Mel?! Standing just off to the side of the door, Leigh looks at Kelli. Then whispers, intensely...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Shut up! Leigh clutches the barbecue fork with two hands, turns toward the door and raises it over her head. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Breathes hard; frightened. She reaches into her pocket and pulls out her cell, fingers trembling as she text messages...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI'S CELL PHONE DISPLAY
dialogues.text: glows with bluish light. She types... "U@?!!" Then, speed dials... MELISSA.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Awaits a response. She kicks at Lauren's foot, waves the flashlight beam across her face...  175 176 89.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: O.S... FOOTSTEPS approach...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: looks to her phone...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI'S CELL PHONE DISPLAY
dialogues.text: The illuminated display reads: U@?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BEGINS MOVING DOWN THE HALL, as if a P.O.V. Flashlight seeps from beneath the door inside Lauren's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises the prongs above her head, readies...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Texts, again. This time... FAINT... MUTED... however, a definitely audible... a cell ring tone can be heard..."JINGLE BELLS." Kelli looks up. CAMERA PUSHES IN as she spots...

dialogues.speaker: CEILING
dialogues.text: From a tiny pinhole in the ceiling, a pale dim hint of bluish light, as if from a cell phone display emits from the hole...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES IN, but just as she reacts...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN'S DOOR
dialogues.text: BANGS open!

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Swings the light toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: A figure stands in the threshold...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: WHISKS her weapon down...  90.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: The light hits the figure REVEALING Kyle as he lurches back, the fork tearing his jacket sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Not knowing Kyle, Leigh continues her attack. Not knowing Leigh, he counters, blocking her arm and shoving her back...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Hits the bed, knocking Lauren whose arm slowly falls from its position over her eyes. Leigh looks up just as Lauren's arm clears her face, REVEALING Lauren is, indeed, dead. Her eye sockets are dark and empty; eyes having been removed.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Is up on her feet away from the bed. She turns back toward Kyle wielding her weapon.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Moves toward her...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: No! NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh hesitates, but remains alert and ready to attack. Likewise, Kyle tenses eyes flashing from Kelli to Leigh. The three stand triangulated; breathing hard, frightened...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: There's two bodies in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Maybe you did it. He points to Lauren...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Maybe you did that!

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: No! It's not him! Leigh's eyes dart to Kelli, as does Kyle's.  177 gl.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: How do you know? Her back to the hole in the ceiling, assuming they are being watched, Kelli blocks her gesture pointing to the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Subtly look up...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES PAST KELLI and RISES to the ceiling. The faint light continues glowing from within the ceiling pinhole...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Her "The Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" ringtone SOUNDS. CAMERA INCHES INTO Kelli as she raises the phone with dread... and pushes the "send" button...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They're my family, now. Kelli battles tears, but with a strength derived from anger, she asks in an accusatory whisper...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: What have you done... Billy? The call abruptly disconnects. Kelli turns, looks to the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: The light is out.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Witness the seeping light go out. They look to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: As CAMERA INCHES TO HER... she whispers.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA IS CREEPING. In the darkness, barely visible... awaits the trap door to the attic.  92.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, LEIGH
dialogues.text: CAMERA INCHES TOWARD Lauren's door as the three appear in the threshold. Kyle steps out and moves toward the stairs. The girls take a step toward the attic door. Kyle turns to check they are following and sees they are not. In a low scared whisper...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No fucking way!

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Clair might be alive. She might be up there.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Eve's not. Heather's not. Ms. Mac.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: They all left the house. He couldn't get them in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: I've searched the whole house.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: And I've seen under the house. Where else could they be?

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Until I see that they're dead... they are alive. He takes Kelli by the arm, for emphasis...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: They're not. Kelli pulls her arm away. She gestures to the weapon in Leigh's hand...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: There's three of us.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (scoffs) It's fucking Billy Lenz! He's probably watching us, right now...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) If I was alive. I would expect my sister to go up there... Leigh eyes Kelli, impressed, and absently nods.  93.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: How would you know? You don't even have a fuckin' sister.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, she does. Leigh doesn't even check Kelli's reaction as she moves past Kyle and Kelli and starts toward the attic trap door, clutching her weapon. Kelli eyes Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: If you don't think you owe me... you fucking owe Megan... at least, this. He grabs the two of them and with emphasis...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: If we go up there... the second we see they're dead... we turn and run the fuck out of this house. Leigh and Kelli consider, then nod. Kyle eyes them for a beat as he reaches into his pocket and removes a butterfly knife. As he flips it open...

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE POSITION OF THE DOOR
dialogues.text: FRAME IS EMPTY, seemingly dark, until Leigh steps cautiously INTO FRAME, back against the farthest wall. Only a faint rim of reflecting spill light delineates Leigh, Kelli, and Kyle from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ATTIC DOOR
dialogues.text: CAMERA INCHES TOWARD the trap door...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The three reach the area just beneath the attic door. Leigh nods to Kelli, then takes a step toward the ladder. Kelli's lifts the flashlight, preparing to turn it on... Kyle suddenly reaches out and stops Leigh. She looks at him and without acknowledging her, Kyle moves ahead of her toward the base of the ladder. He turns to Kelli, then mouths and gestures...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I open the door, you hit the light. She nods...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DIRECTLY UP
dialogues.text: The trap door awaits directly above as Kyle steps on the first rung of the ladder...  94.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE'S FOOT
dialogues.text: CAMERA RISES with Kyle's foot as it steps on the next rung...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: Kelli raises it; thumb hovering over the "on" switch.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Grips the barbecue fork, readies...

dialogues.speaker: OVERHEAD
dialogues.text: Kyle rises toward CAMERA, reaching the door. He eyes the girls, then holds out his hand and counts off with his fingers... one... two... three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KNOCKS open the door, then takes a defensive step down. Kelli turns on the flashlight. Beat... SILENCE... above Kyle, the flashlight is a tube of illumination on the rafters. Small, one or two inch icicles cling to the leaking ceiling... Kyle turns around and reaches down, gesturing for Kelli's flashlight... Suddenly, a black plastic trash bag is whipped over Kyle's head. His upper body is pulled into the attic...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: step forward, reach out, but cannot grab Kyle's legs.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: knocked by Kyle's hand, spins rolls...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Begins climbing the ladder, looks up...

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTIC
dialogues.text: The flashlight stops bouncing and spinning, its light stops on... a pair of eyes... framed in a black hood. In a mere glimpse, the most illuminated eye, the left iris... is yellow.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Struggling violently, stabs blindly with his knife as he disappears into the darkness of the attic. The door

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: Rush toward the ladder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme elongated shadows are created by the flashlight struggle. The killer straddles Kyle's chest.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE'S FEET
dialogues.text: Struggling to escape, Kyle's feet are over the attic door. Kicking; pressing against the floor for leverage. His desperate actions prevent Kelli and Leigh from entering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push up against the door while it BANG BANG BANGS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinded and choking from the plastic bag. His arms, including the hand holding his butterfly knife, are pinned down by the assailant straddling his chest.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: Removes the glass unicorn from a pocket. Raises it...

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS UNICORN
dialogues.text: The light glinting off the horn, is plunged OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S., KYLE SCREAMS! Kelli and Leigh intensify their efforts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, plunges the glass dagger toward Kyle's head...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE'S FEET
dialogues.text: Reacting to the pain... PUSH AGAINST FLOOR and SCUTTLE BACK.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: Is bucked, but maintains the advantage...  183 184 96.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE'S FEET
dialogues.text: Move off of the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push! The door flies open! They hurry up the ladder. Once inside, the attic door teeters, then SLAMS closed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli and Leigh charge the figure, just as it plunges the pointed horn into the plastic bag. Kyle's body goes limp. They grab the killer, who rears, pushing them deep into the attic.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Fall against the base of a rocking chair, which lurches forward, toward them. They look up...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: The face of Leigh's sister remains frozen in horror, wrapped in plastic. Eye sockets, empty. Seated in the chair, the body nearly tips over on them...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: FRAME IS EMPTY until she rears back, terrified...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH'S FOOT AND LEG
dialogues.text: Slips off the plywood covered area and into the rock wool insulation. Her foot CRASHES through the plaster...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: One leg falls through the floor to her thigh...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: On the floor, scoots on her hands and behind, away from Clair. Kelli looks to Leigh...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: struggling to pull herself out, yet the movements cause her to slip further into the hole...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Her eyes flash to Kyle...  97.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: The Killer straddles Kyle's motionless body. The Killer rises. Nearly indiscernible in the flashlight, the killer clenches several strands of extracolar muscles attached to Kyle's removed eyeballs.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: He's my family, now. The killer grabs Kyle's body by the legs and begins dragging it across the room...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Her eyes flash toward Leigh...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Slips a few more inches into the floor. She looks to Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Kelli rises to her hands and knees, crawling, quickly, but cautiously across the attic floor toward Leigh...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Tries pulling herself out of the floor. CRACK! She slips further...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: As Kelli reaches Leigh and grabs her arms...

dialogues.speaker: A MATCH
dialogues.text: Strikes.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Turn toward the light...

dialogues.speaker: A CHRISTMAS CANDLE
dialogues.text: Red and silvery; is lit...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA INCHES IN ON THEM, reacting with horror...  98.

dialogues.speaker: A FORM
dialogues.text: A body, a silhouette in the darkness... until the candle cast an amber glow... REVEALING... Melissa's dead body. The eye sockets are empty and black. O.S., the HUMMING continues...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: frightened. Sickened.

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND CANDLE
dialogues.text: Is lit...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: The flickering light dances across her dead, expressionless, face. Her eyes have been removed...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES TOWARD THEM... both frozen and mortified...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: In the corner... a display. The sincere intent had been a Currier and Ives family at Christmas print, however, it appears as if sculpted by an insane Gothik/Punk artist. The bodies of the murdered sorority sisters, Megan, Clair, and Melissa are posed, as if exchanging presents, beneath an Evergleam pink aluminum Christmas tree. Seven pairs of actual human eyeballs ornament the tree. A dozen candles illuminate the area. Placed on the floor are sheets of crumpled wrapping paper, ribbon and bows, as if presents have jest been opened. Clair's music box is placed in Megan's hands.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: HUMMING Tchaikovsky, turns toward Kelli and Leigh. The yellow, unblinking, unmoving eye, catches some spill light. Then with a tone heard in the phone calls, one that is not not evil or crazed, but rather eerily pathetic with a pleased, happy smile, spoken to Kelli and Leigh... and quoting Melissa...

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Everyone should be home for Christmas.  99. The figure starts toward them...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND LEIGH
dialogues.text: Trembling and rattled, try pulling Leigh from the floor who grasps the wooden supports; strains...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH'S LEGS
dialogues.text: Slips deeper through the plaster.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: Approaches...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Suddenly... CRACK! The floor gives way. Collapses! Leigh falls through the floor and into one of the girls's bedroom. Kelli turns, checks the killer's position...

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: a step away...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Tries to jump through the hole in the floor, but the killer grabs her shoulders. A plastic bag begins whipping over her head, but Kelli raises an arm and blocks it. She lunges forward...

dialogues.speaker: THE BBQ FORK
dialogues.text: Kelli grabs it...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Rolls, turns, then drives the weapon toward the killer...

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER'S EYES
dialogues.text: The prongs plunge into the yellowed iris. The figure's head is thrown back.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Kelli rears, looking up to the figure...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: The hooded head slowly levels. Oddly, the fork remains in the eyeball with no release of blood or fluid. The fork extends out, stuck in the eye.  100.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Reacts, shocked, confused...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: A first true look at the face of the figure, albeit in the eerie flickering amber light, REVEALS an unnerving androgyny. Although the face is large and, somewhat, masculine, the lips and nose are feminine. The skin texture appears shiny, plastic-like and sweaty. Thick scar tissue encircles the neck. With no reaction of pain or emotion, the figure reaches up, grabs the fork handle, and with effort, twists the fork and head until the prosthetic eye is pulled from the socket.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROSTHETIC EYE
dialogues.text: remains on the tip of the fork. At this image size, it is clear that the iris has been hand painted or tinted yellow...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: The empty socket is black with scar tissue. The head turns, looking at the eye on the end of the fork and REVEALING the surviving right eye is a brilliant bright blue...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN, repulsed, frozen with fear and shock. She whispers...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: They are not your family... Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Indeed, the killer, Agnes Lenz, drops the fork...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Although trembling with fear, addresses Agnes...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am not your family. You're brother is not here.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: reacts... doesn't understand. She considers... then, with an eerie child-like smile...  101.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: But... my daddy is.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Kelli doesn't understand. Then, suddenly... MUTED... "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy" CHIMES from her back pocket. Her expression flashes a hope of possibility... as she hustles toward the attic door while removing her cellphone from her back pocket. She is SCREAMING, PLEADING for help before she manages to engage the phone...

dialogues.speaker: OAKDALE LANE...
dialogues.text: Kelli reaches the door, however...

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: A hatch lifting ring is inset and flush against the wood. Kelli's trembling fingers struggle to lift the ring.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Approaches...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWEEPS IN AS FROM THE PHONE... the chilling, now familiar voice calmly declares...

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're... my family now. Kelli reacts, stunned and puzzled. Behind her, Agnes whisks a green Hefty trash bag whips over Kelli's head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASPS! The plastic vacuums to her face. She stumbles to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: straddles Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Tears the plastic away...  185 102.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Raises the glass unicorn...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Dekes her head. The glass spike catches a piece of her earlobe as it drives into the floor and breaks off. Kelli grabs Agnes' wrist...

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: looks at the ornament. Now, a block of glass...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Quickly grabs for the broken glass spike. Grabs it. She plunges her hand upward...

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Brings the glass rock downwards, but Kelli's weapon makes impact first, plunging just below the right eye socket. As she rears back, Kelli grabs Agnes' arm with both hands, trying to free the ornament from Agnes' hand.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Knocks the ornament from Agnes' hand...

dialogues.speaker: THE ORNAMENT
dialogues.text: Knocks over a pair of candles...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND AGNES
dialogues.text: Agnes maintains a grasp on Kelli. They fall backwards...

dialogues.speaker: A CANDLE
dialogues.text: Lands atop a piece of wrapping paper on the ground. It begins burning beneath the flammable tree...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI AND AGNES
dialogues.text: Stumble backward toward the wall and to fall into the space between the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutches grabs, trying to break her fall.  186 187 188 189 103.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Tumbles grotesquely all the way to the basement...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Manages to break and stop her fall at some point mid way between the attic and the basement. She breathes hard...

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN THE WALLS
dialogues.text: Agnes, from the base of the house begins climbing toward Kelli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies on the floor, disoriented and stunned. She awakens upon HEARING KELLI'S calls for help.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Kelli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli KNOCKS on the wall, pushes against it.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: LEIGH?! LEIGH?! In the wall. I can't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initially, Leigh is confused. Kelli's CRIES, however, can be heard within the wall. Leigh moves to the wall and places her ear against the wood, trying to determine Kelli's position.

dialogues.speaker: SHE'S IN HERE
dialogues.text: Leigh turns and quickly tries to find a heavy object in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: She stumbles upon a pair of ten pound aerobic dumbbells...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelli looks down...  190 191 192 193 104.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Is climbing toward her...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Bangs on the wall... tries to push...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Hearing Leigh's voice, Kelli begins pounding on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh attempts to discern Kelli's position, listening to the KNOCKING within the wall. Leigh places her ear to the wall for one final check. Leigh rears back with the dumbbell and smashes the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, near the lip of the wall... rolls with the concussion of the dumbbell impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! Again, until finally, a hole is created...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks up...

dialogues.speaker: UP THE WALL
dialogues.text: The interior of the wall is very dark, except for the faint amber glow of the candles high above in the attic. A faint patch of light spills from the hole Leigh created in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves to the wall to look into the hole. Suddenly a male arm flies out of the hole and grabs Leigh, wrapping around her neck and pulling her to the wall

dialogues.speaker: HOLE IN THE WALL
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWEEPS IN TO REVEAL BILLY LENZ. His yellow eyes intense as Leigh escaping his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: the wall ERUPTS as Billy's other arm POUNDS through the wall. His hand grab at Leigh's eyes, trying to pull them out. She struggles, battles, then manages to swing the dumbbell up upon the clutching arm.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: In the momentary easing of his grasp, pulls away. Holding the dumbbell, she tears out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks down...

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Climbs up toward her...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Looks up...

dialogues.speaker: UP THE WALL
dialogues.text: Through the light in the wall, sees another form. It turns within the wall with the ease of a cockroach. In the dim light, Billy's face looks directly toward her...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: As he starts toward her...  196 197 198 199 200 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh bounds down the stairway and toward the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LEADS Leigh as she opens a door...

dialogues.speaker: KELLI
dialogues.text: Within the walls, muted POUNDING! It appears to be in the other room. Leigh moves on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes scales the wall, growing closer to Kelli, who tries to move, but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: crawls toward Kelli, below him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh races to the next door. As she opens it, a form appears to be waiting for her. Leigh SCREAMS! It is the laundry room. Some clothes hang near the door. Leigh brushes them aside and moves to the wall. Kelli's SCREAMS seem to be directly on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH
dialogues.text: Leigh realizes she does not know Kelli's exact location. Leigh taps the wall, tries to locate Kelli's position...

dialogues.speaker: HURRY
dialogues.text: On reflex, Leigh rears back and swings the dumbbell toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foot from her head, the wall buckles. CRACKS.  201 202 203 204 205 206 207 208

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocks... rolls toward the discarded wrapping paper. It catches fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! The wall buckles again!

dialogues.speaker: KELLI'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Agnes is close enough to reach for it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: out of a nightmare... crab crawls toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
